AutoBot?
Your AutoBot is able to collect detailed
driving data through your vehicle's OBD-II port.  It keeps constant track of your fuel
consumption and driving habits to let you know how much you've spent in fuel
per drive, and suggest ways to change your driving habits in order to improve
gas mileage.  The AutoBot is able to
watch over your vehicle's major systems and inform you in case of malfunctions.  Using low-power Bluetooth 4.0, the AutoBot
syncs vehicle data with your iPhone or Android handset and present all your
vehicle's info in our beautifully designed AutoBot App.
Furthermore, the AutoBot can record your
vehicle's travel route, including stoppage time, location, speed and
acceleration data to form a personalized history of your trip.  By combining the geo-tag and time stamp on
your photos, AutoBot can create beautifully detailed trip memories that you can
play back and share with friends and families.
We have been able to improve signal processing
and reduce interference through advanced materials and design.  As a result, the AutoBot is able to maintain
the consistent GPS signal reception throughout your travel.
2. Does it support OBD-II interface module?
We've received lots of questions regarding
AutoBot and OBD-II.  We have decided to
combine the questions and answer them in this section.
OBD-II, short for On-board diagnostics,
refers to the vehicle's self-diagnostic and reporting capability.  It can provide a range of information from
fuel consumption, water temperature, engine speed, to a series of diagnostic
trouble codes.  OBD-II is equipped on
vehicles manufactured since 2007.
In short, the AutoBot fully supports OBD-II
interface module.  However, AutoBot isn't
limited to only newer vehicles.  For
those without OBD-II interface module, the AutoBot will use its internal GPS,
gyroscope and processing unit to calculate your driving habit and fuel
consumption.  For those with OBD-II, it
will read the fuel consumption, water temperature, engine speed and other
vehicle data through the interface.
The AutoBot comes with two connectors.  If your vehicle is 2007 or newer and supports
OBD-II, then you can connect the AutoBot to said interface.  If your vehicle does not support OBD-II, you can
still obtain basic driving data by connecting the AutoBot to your vehicle's
12-V receptacle (commonly known as the cigarette lighter)
3. Questions related to power connector
3.1 Why don't you just make AutoBot connect
directly to the cigarette lighter or OBD-II interface plug?  Wouldn't that avoid having to wire the
AutoBot to the vehicle's power source separately?
We have considered doing so.  However, the location and placement of the
12-V receptacle and the OBD-II interface plug varies between manufacturers and
vehicle models.  This uncertainty means
on some applications the GPS signal reception may be weakened.  In order to ensure the best user experience
and stability in signal reception, we have designed the AutoBot to perform at
its best located on the center console. 
The carefully crafted unit will complement all types of vehicle cabins
beautifully.  The AutoBot is able to
achieve its look and function by using both an internal battery and dedicated
power wiring.
3.2 Why did you choose to use both a
battery and power wire?
The AutoBot is equipped with an internal
battery to ensure that you can still sync its data via Bluetooth within 1-2
hours after you've turned your vehicle off.
We have decided not to use a larger battery
in place of the power wire, once again to ensure we have a consistent, complete
and accurate record of the driving history. 
If we use only the battery to power the AutoBot, our users will run the
risk of losing the precious data when the battery runs out.
We also feel that in order for the AutoBot
to truly make a difference in our daily driving habits and keep track of
vehicle functionalities, using it must be intuitive.  If we have to constantly remember to recharge
the unit on a regular basis, chances are the data collected won't be complete,
and we would have to deal with the eventual degradation of battery
capacity.  If we are able to power the
unit constantly, whether it's through the 12-V receptacle or the OBD-II
connector, then we can guarantee that as long as the vehicle is travelling, the
data will be recorded.
4. How do you transfer data from the
AutoBot, and will it affect my handset battery?
The AutoBot is equipped with internal
memory that can store 60 days worth of vehicle and driving data.  Syncing is as simple as turning on your
handset's Bluetooth and has the AutoBot app running.  Once paired, the syncing is automatic.  The AutoBot uses its own internal GPS
hardware, and will not engage your handset's GPS chipset, so it will not
adversely affect your handset battery life.
5. Can you incorporate dash-cam into
AutoBot?
We have received numerous emails requesting
that we combine dash-cam functions into AutoBot.  At this early stage, we have decided to focus
our limited resource on the core functionality. 
We will take a look at incorporating dash-cam into AutoBot once we are
satisfied with its core performance.
6. Can AutoBot support multiple vehicles?
Yes it can. 
AutoBot syncs with your handset, and once it is synchronized, your data
will be stored in the cloud.  You can
create different accounts to keep track of different vehicle data.
7. How is AutoBot different from other
OBD-II productions on the market?
Currently, most OBD-II products capture GPS
data through the handset's GPS chipset, so the bulk of the processing is done
by your handset.  This means your phone
has to be connected to a power source constantly and the recording app has to
be turned on at all times.  As a result,
the users tend to stop using such product after forgetting to turn it on a
couple of times.  
Our goal is to give you the most simple way
of capturing your travel log, complete with driving history, habits, and
vehicle diagnostic information, therefore we chose to combine all the data
collection and processing into the AutoBot unit itself, so you won't have to
think about turning anything else on apart from your ignition, and the AutoBot
will collect, process and store automatically. 
All your data is just sync away._________________________________________________________________________Why Indiegogo?
We have developed several
product based on china market. We developed an application-pathbook, which was
also available on the other countries app store and became very popular. We got
many kindly users all over the world. Since then, we start to think about the
international market, we should make our product known by more people, not only
in China. AutoBot is a good product without any geographic restrictions;
Indiegogo is a friendly and open platform. So we just COME!You can jump to our website to get more information. we will launch the English version of our website very soon.
Our goal is set of $ 10000,
which will allow us to begin serial manufacturing and make AutoBot widely
available as soon as July 2014.  Status updating We will update our production status here at least once two-weeks. Now we are working on the application development and also the AutoBot scepter. 
Use of fund
Every dollar we raised here
will go directly to application development and manufacturing of AutoBot. 
Media or Business
contact:
We are happy to talk about
AutoBot.Please contact: Fendicheng@vgoapp.com for further conversation. Other Ways You Can HelpNot only contribution can help us, if you love AutoBot, Please share this link via twitter, Facebook or other social tools to make loud noise for AutoBot. And welcome to the Chinese social media Weibo & Weixin (Wechat) Sina Weibo: @AutoBotOr add AutoBot to your Wechat:  2406037717

story:
PiPiano is going to get its own website, with docs and a forum!

FUNDED! In less than a week, we have all the money to make PiPiano a reality! Thank you to all our contributors, and anyone who shared or helped PiPiano! Please continue to support and share PiPiano! If you have any stretch goal ideas, let me know!

Story

At just 14 years old, Zach is a Raspberry Pi prodigy and regular attendee at Cambridge Raspberry Jams where he demonstrates his Pi robotics projects.

He wanted to create a Piano with his Raspberry Pi, but adding switches to a real piano would be a wiring nightmare, and involve taking the piano apart and doing unspeakable things to it. The solution? Create a simple, piano-style add-on for the Raspberry Pi which includes buttons in a piano octave formation, and a piezo transducer for sound output.

After trying it on a breadboard, and being swamped with bundles of spaghetti wiring, he opted to lay out the idea on a PCB. Doing so is an effort in itself, however, so he chose to make it as flexible and expandable as possible.

What is it?

The PiPiano uses an i2c I/O expander to connect the buttons, eliminating the need for 13 GPIO pins and leaving nearly all of them free for other projects. Also, with only 13 of the 16 expander pins used, adding 3 LEDs was a no-brainer; these are great for keeping time while playing.

The result? A Pi add-on board which includes 13 buttons, great for either music or controlling projects, and 3 LEDs, handy for keeping time or notifications.

The board uses the well known and well supported MCP23017 IO expander chip which has become a mainstay with Raspberry Pi projects. It’s easy to talk to, and uses only i2c on address 0x20, leaving all of the GPIO pins, except for the one used by the piezo, accessible via an optional stacking header.

That’s 17 IO components, and only 3 pins used!

What can you do with it?

PiPiano is a great little classroom board, with the potential to teach soldering skills and allow the exploration of music and sound generation. The readily available code shows how PWM frequency corresponds to a musical note.

When it’s not a Piano, it’s a handy controller with an ample supply of buttons which could be used in an automation project, a D.I.Y. Turtle, shortcut buttons to run scripts on your Pi, or anything else you can imagine.

Because it uses only a few GPIO pins and a common, well documented i2c IO expander, it can be easily combined with a number of other Pi peripherals. You can use it as part of a more complex setup or, if you’re determined, even as input for an Arduino-based project.

Why Indiegogo?

Zach may be only 14, but he’s well connected with the Pi community and has received good feedback and a green light for making PiPiano a reality. What he doesn’t have, however, is money to invest and fund the production of PCBs. This is where you come in- through Indiegogo you’ll provide the support needed to get PiPiano off the ground. Without that support, it simply can’t happen!

What do you get?

Due to its 26pin header ( Model B, Model A ) the PiPiano is compatible with all Raspberry Pi models including Model A, Model B (all revisions) and the new Model B+. It comes as either a kit, or ready soldered. PiPiano includes:

  1. PiPiano PCB

  2. 13 tactile switches

  3. Red LED

  4. Yellow LED

  5. Green LED

  6. Piezo Transducer

  7. MCP23017

  8. Resistors

  9. Capacitor

  10. 26-pin header ( optional stackable upgrade )

PiPiano comes either soldered, as a kit, and with either a standard header or a stacking header. UK delivery is included, or you can have your PiPiano delivered internationally for a small extra sum.

Tier  | Standard Header  | Stacking Header   | Soldered   | Unsoldered

A                      X                                   -                             -                      X

B                      X                                   -                             X                     -

C                      -                                    X                            -                      X

Documentation & Examples

See the GitHub repository: https://github.com/ZacharyIgielman/PiPiano

Here you can find a comprehensive set of documentation including detailed assembly instructions, and tutorials for using PiPiano plus a ready-to-play Python example, with a complete equivalent written in C. There’s also a Sonic Pi integration, which generates a file you can load up and play in Sonic Pi.

The tutorials cover each aspect of PiPiano in both Python, using Adafruit_I2C and RPi.GPIO, and C, using WiringPi. We hope they serve as a gentle introduction to lights, buttons and buzzers in C.

When complete we hope the documentation will include guides for:

  • Assembling and soldering the board, with a basic intro to soldering

  • Sounding the buzzer at different pitches using Python/C on the Pi

  • Reading the buttons from the MCP23017 i2c IO expander.

  • Driving the LEDs from the MCP23017 i2c IO expander

  • Making a simple, one-octave piano with LED metronome

Using Python, you can hook PiPiano up to a variety of applications- we’ve managed to get it working with PureData and even Sunvox, making the tiny little keyboard into a powerful polyphonic software synthesizer or a souped-up stylophone.

story:
Short Summary

All the twitter apps for Android are pretty rubbish in my honest opinion so my aim is to write one that looks fantastic and works equally as well.

What We Need & What You Get

As you all know i work full time and can only do this development  in my own time. If i continue in this way the app would take several months to complete.

I am looking to get this money together so i can hire some assistance and get this app done much quicker.


IMPORTANT NOTE

There is a spelling error on the two investment categories. It won't let me edit!

story:
Short Summary

The Bambie PC is a workstation that will provide a lot of wonderful services for our community! We agree that the 'Bambie' PC will play a huge part in running our community and a fantastic binding project for us all!

About the PC!

The following are a list of the basic specifications of this PC:
  • NZXT H440 MID-TOWER BLACK/RED GAMING CASE
  • Intel® Core™i7 Quad Core Processor i7-4820K (3.7GHz) 10MB Cache
  • 32GB KINGSTON HYPER-X BEAST DUAL-DDR3 2133MHz X.M.P (4 x 8GB KIT)
  • ASUS® P9X79 LE: INTEL® SOCKET LG2011
  • 3GB NVIDIA GEFORCE GTX 780 - 2 DVI, HDMI, DP 
  • 500GB Samsung 840 EVO SSD, SATA 6Gb/s (upto 540MB/sR | 520MB/
As you can tell this PC has an awful lot of power and we certainly are not afraid to use it! We will also be customizing the computer to represent the Bambie logo!
Uses of the PC
The PC certainly as a lot of potential, not to mention power, so we will be using this fantastic opportunity to our advantage!
List of things the PC will be used for!
  • Server hosting - Teamspeak - Game servers etc 
  • Game development workstation - high end games will be created using this PC.
  • Benchmarker - New and exciting games will be benchmarked using this PC and included in the steam curator details!
  • Streamer Platform - High end games at full 1080p will be streamed on services such as Twitch for your enjoyment!
  • Video Editing Workstation / Rendering Station - With this incredible amount of power we will be able to render videos at full 4k!

Benchmarker - New and exciting games will be benchmarked using this PC and included in the steam curator details!
Streamer Platform - High end games at full 1080p will be streamed on services such as Twitch for your enjoyment!
Video Editing Workstation / Rendering Station - With this incredible amount of power we will be able to render videos at full 4k!

story:
Earn Free GoGo Lamps or 8 GB Memory Card - 

see bottom

GoGo Lamps - Great for dorms, apartments, camping, even on the back of a bike or stroller.


2 Internal Speakers + Metal Casing = Maximum Sight and Sound Enjoyment 

  • The LED lights have pre-programmed lighting patterns
  • When paired with a phone via Bluetooth or audio line in, they move to the beat and put on a light show
  • No phone? Pop in a micro SD memory card with your playlist
  • The 2 powerful internal speakers can fill a small room or even outdoors
  • Built-in mic for hands free Speakerphone function 
  • The small sizes fit on any desktop and powers with any USB charger
  • Rechargeable Lithium batteries last up to 8 Hours

There are dozens of small Bluetooth speakers with LED lights that are great entertainment when used with your iPhone or Android phone. The best ones on the market retail for $200 and more. One of our engineering staff is a recent college grad, and got one of those for Christmas.

He was inspired and convinced us to give him free rein to come up with a design that would be affordable, but still pack many more features for a busy lifestyle.  When we saw his design, we knew it will benefit many people, especially young people on a budget.  

Even though it's 7 sided (to keep it from rolling when horizontal), we named it Hex because it has LED's on 6 of 7 sides and sound in 308 degrees.  It even fits inside most cup and bottle holders for the ultimate bike safety light!

Design Features That Make Hex Better:

  • Metal and silicone casing for toughness and BASS
  • 2 Speakers inside for better stereo sound
  • 7 Flat sides to not roll around like round lamps
  • Bigger LED's for a brighter lamp day or night
  • Hands free speakerphone with microphone


Indiegogo Price $36 + shipping


Two Pack $68 + shipping


Three Pack $95 + shipping 


What will we do with your funds?

We have already paid for everything needed to start production-PCB designs, case molds, etc.  In fact, we have pre-orders from our resellers and know the ratio of direct sales to wholesale orders.  Your Perks contributions will help us lower our costs even more because we will be able to buy more components.

Guaranteed Shipping by October, 2015.  If we miss the shipping date, we will gladly refund your contribution.

We believe in Transparency

As with our other campaigns, your feedback and comments will help us fine tune our product.  


Risks and Challenges

UNiFLASH has been in business since 2011. We specialize in external drives for iOS and Android mobile devices that have unlimited storage capacity. However, we also design and manufacture products for other brands too.  When we saw the design and the effort that our staff put into the GoGo Lamp Hex model, we knew that we had to get it out there ourselves when school starts in October.  One of our current manufacturing partners will dedicate a new line for the production of this model. 

Guaranteed Shipping by late October, 2015.  If we miss the shipping date, we will gladly refund your contribution via Paypal.

Earn Free GoGo Lamps or 8 GB Memory Card

1.  We will credit $2 towards your contribution for every Referred Contribution just for sharing our campaign.  Here's how it works:

  • When you sign up and contribute to our campaign, your user name will be inserted in the Share button links under our campaign video
  • Click on the Share buttons to let your friends know about our campaign.  When they contribute, it will go into your record and we an see it in our dashboard.
  • At the end of the campaign, we will tally up the total and credit your Paypal account up to the full amount of your original contribution

2.  Get a free 8 GB micro SD memory card just by sharing our campaign, and leave a COMMENT that includes: "Add FREE 8 GB Bonus"

Thank you for sharing.

1.  We will credit $2 towards your contribution for every Referred Contribution just for sharing our campaign.  Here's how it works:

When you sign up and contribute to our campaign, your user name will be inserted in the Share button links under our campaign video
Click on the Share buttons to let your friends know about our campaign.  When they contribute, it will go into your record and we an see it in our dashboard.
At the end of the campaign, we will tally up the total and credit your Paypal account up to the full amount of your original contribution


2.  Get a free 8 GB micro SD memory card just by sharing our campaign, and leave a COMMENT that includes: "Add FREE 8 GB Bonus"

story:
Update 10/01/2017: All backers who pre-order HELLO before 30th of September will get FREE lifetime use. Purchase your device NOW and communicate efficiently for the rest of your life.

 

With a 4K camera sensor and an array of microphones, HELLO is designed to transform your TV into a video and audio communication device for collaboration and meetings in Huddle rooms, Office & Home conference rooms.

HELLO easily connects to any TV and provides an all-in-one, voice-controlled smart-home or office-device for:

1. Video and Audio Conferencing

Whether you want to have one-on-one video calls or group calls; HELLO and the Solaborate Messenger platform support you in it. HELLO is incredibly easy to set up, that’s what makes you experience effortless meetings with colleagues, friends and even clients.

With a 4K camera sensor and an array of microphones, HELLO is a powerful and flawless solution for you and your team to collaborate, interact, and share your thoughts and ideas through video and audio conferencing.

2. Wireless Screencasting and Screen Sharing

Nothing is more frustrating than wanting to share your screen during a meeting and having to deal with a bunch of cables you know anything of. Share your laptop or phone screen wirelessly through HELLO to easily engage with your team and increase efficiency during meetings through Wireless Screencasting and Screen Sharing.

Besides, it’ll guarantee an easy-going meeting that focuses on productivity instead of on the setup of equipment. 

3. Camera feed with motion detection. 

Keep an eye on your office or home with HELLO’s Camera Feed & Motion Detection. Motion activated notifications alert you when unusual activity is detected, so that you can put your mind at ease when you are away.

4. Live broadcasting

HELLO makes it simple for you to globally stream live events to your colleagues and loved ones whenever something captivating happens near you. It’s the easiest way to engage with your network and audience, which results in a better relationship with them.

HELLO works as an easy extension of the already feature-rich Solaborate platform - designed for both individuals and teams working remotely that expect high quality, ease of use and feature rich experiences.

AS SEEN:

 

Have you tried to share ideas with your team through video conferencing? Existing solutions offer a clumsy and bloated experience. The easy setup and affordable price of HELLO are the things that differentiate HELLO from other equipment possibilities. HELLO is simple, and streamlined.

HELLO is an affordable alternative to high-end video conferencing systems. Backers can get one for $299.

HELLO works with Amazon Alexa

We’ve added Alexa to the HELLO device to give you yet another way to engage with the HELLO device on a daily basis.

The best part of it all is that you won’t need an Alexa device separately, HELLO does the work for you! HELLO works with Amazon Alexa, which makes the HELLO device an all-in-one solution for you!

HELLO device WORKS with: Solaborate Messenger, Skype, Skype for Business, WebEx, Google Meet & Hangouts, Facebook Messenger, WeChat, Amazon Chime, Zoom, BlueJeans, GoToMeeting, and more.

HELLO combines powerful hardware and software to give you an integrated, enjoyable and seamless experience. 

 

Joining a Group Conference Call is Simple through the Solaborate application or through the Solaborate website. Conference calls can be taken from home, the office, or on your smartphone.

HELLO is engineered with an array of microphones, a 4K video sensor and quad-core processor working together to guarantee that every person in the room is seen and heard clearly. HELLO also features both a built-in accelerometer, tilting and wide lens of vision, to ensure easy setup on any TV and the image captured is of the highest quality.

HELLO is crafted from machined aluminum for a combination of reliable durability and elegance for a seamless addition to your office or home.

HELLO connects to your screen via HDMI cable and can connect to your network via WI-FI or ethernet cable. Simple setup so your time can be spent wisely.

 

 Step 1:

HELLO can mount on the top of your TV and monitor. 

 Step 2:

Two simple connections: Power and HDMI connection

 Step 3:

Download the application and scan your phone to connect

 

HELLO is easy to set up and use. 

Plug HELLO into your TV or video monitor and download the HELLO app to your mobile device to begin. In the app, you will name the device, assign it to the network you use, and select a few preferences; the app will then generate a QR code, which you will hold up to HELLO’s lens to complete the setup. After the device is set up, you can immediately use it.  

How was HELLO born

We didn’t see anything else better on the market and decided to create it ourselves. HELLO is for the people, at an affordable price point -- built for modern businesses, professionals, freelancers and creators. It cuts out the cost of networked conferencing hardware and IT services to install and maintain it. We’re truly bringing professional-grade video conferencing to everyone, anywhere, on any device. 

First Prototype

Second Prototype 

Final Prototype 

The HELLO team is made up of innovators and project leaders. Their organization and process-driven approach ensure rapid iteration and lean techniques for increased efficiency. Having built the Solaborate platform, each team member is intimately familiar with the methods of communication we all use on a daily basis and have thus created the best possible platform suitable for a device as sophisticated as HELLO. 

Risks and challenges

Design and ease-of-use is something we are incredibly passionate about. We’ve poured our effort into the careful design & exemplary prototypes for HELLO. We invested heavily into building the device and have integrated several technologies into a beautiful, seamless experience built for our users’ needs.

We have built a device that we love and are comfortable sharing with you, using the best materials, components, and software available. As with any product designed for mass production, manufacturing HELLO requires injection molding, equipment setup, and certifications that may demand additional costs and development time. Being a backer of HELLO goes a long way to help us as we continue to streamline our process to make it more affordable and easier to use.

We are confident in our designs, coding, and our manufacturing partners’ experience and skills in bringing HELLO to you as scheduled; however, it is also important to us that we perfect our production lines and build a product with the highest possible quality. As a backer of HELLO, you will have access to all of our features, free of charge. It’s our way of saying thank you.

Our development team is up to the task, and unless confronted with an issue beyond human control, we will deliver an extraordinary new collaboration tool to you that will change your creative experience for the better.

story:
We are now shipping within 1-2 business days in the US, Canada, UK, EU, and the Rest of the World

Orders can be placed on myteracube.com (supports Paypal, Amazon Pay, Apple Pay, and all major credit cards)

 

Hey Backers - we're back with our next phone after successfully delivering our first product - Teracube One. Teracube 2e has a replaceable battery, is DIY repairable, made from recycled material, and comes with a sturdy biodegradable case.

We are also excited to announce that we are expanding Teracube 2e's 4-year premium care warranty to the UK, Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Netherlands, and Poland in addition to the US and Canada.

 

 

Yes, we’ve brought back the replaceable battery. Tired of losing battery performance over the year? It’s one of the main reasons people throw away their old phone. Whenever your battery starts losing performance, just pop the back and replace it. Yes, we’ve got backup batteries for you, too. It is 4000mAh capacity and can last up to 2 days on a single charge.

 

 

Our phone is DIY repairable, meaning you can fix some of the components yourself or you can take advantage of our 4-year premium care warranty plan and we'll do it for you! Most smartphones use tons of glue, we don't. We use screws and replaceable components making it easy to do it yourself with the provided instructions.

 

 

 

 

Eco-friendly composition

The packaging is made with recycled paper and printed using soy ink.

 

50% reduced packaging

Teracube 2e's packaging is also 50% smaller than typical smartphone packaging. We did this by eliminating redundant accessories - the charger, cable, and earphones which most users already have. The smaller packaging will also reduce carbon emissions from shipping.

 

USB-C compatible

Teracube 2e can only charge with USB-A (regular USB socket) to USB-C chargers/cables and can not charge using USB-C PD chargers.

 

*earphones not included

Specifications

Operating System: Android 10.0 with Google Play Store

Processor: MediaTek Helio A25 Octa-core processor 1.8Ghz

Memory: 4GB RAM with 64GB storage

Screen: 6.1” HD+ IPS Display (720X1560)

Rear Camera: 13+8MP

Front Camera: 8MP

Battery: 4000mAh replaceable lithium-ion polymer battery

Security: PIN, pattern, fingerprint, face unlock

Connectivity: WiFi A/B/G/N/AC, Bluetooth 5.0, NFC (Supports Google Pay)

GPS: GPS (AGPS), GLONASS, Galileo

Ports: Headphone Jack, USB-C port, Dedicated Dual SIM with separate Micro SD slot

Size: 155.2mm x 73.3mm x 10.1mm

Weight: 190g

Color: Black

LTE (4G): 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 12, 17, 20

GSM: 850, 900, 1800, 1900

3G: 1, 2, 4, 5, 8

Warranty: 4 Year Premium Care with Flat Fee Repairs
 

What's in the box: Smartphone, screen protector, and bio-compostable case. 

Most smartphones last an average of 2 years or less. Teracube 2e is engineered to last longer and is backed by the industry's first 4-year premium care warranty to ensure you can enjoy your device with peace of mind.

Sustainable Design

Teracube is good for our planet, too. Unlike other smartphones, Teracube 2e is built with sustainability in mind. Made with 25% recycled polycarbonate, includes a bio-degradable case and a replaceable battery -- you can just pop open the back and change it yourself, just like the good old days! With Teracube 2e, you get a great performing phone at a great price, all the while making a difference for our environment.

 

Reduce e-waste

Smartphones’ biggest environmental impact comes from the manufacturing process and the e-waste when discarded. Over 150 million smartphones are thrown away every year in the US alone. The longer you keep Teracube, the more sustainable it becomes. It is not only good for the earth, it’s great on your wallet as well!  And, for every phone sold, we are planting a tree. Can your smartphone company say that?

Teracube’s 4-year hassle-free warranty promises high performance for years to come - ensuring you can keep one piece of personal technology for a longer period of time, keeping your wallet happy and the planet healthy.

 

 

 

Warranty Coverage

Teracube 2e warranty covers all parts, performance, labor, and two-way shipping at no cost to you. Free warranty shipping for 2e will be available in the US, Canada, UK, Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Netherlands, and Singapore. The warranty does cover every country in the world, but if you're not in the countries mentioned above you'll have to cover shipping for repairs. 

Express Replacement

We understand you depend on your phone day-in and day-out. This is why we offer an express replacement option so that you will never be without a phone should something unforeseen happen.

Accidental Repairs

Accidents happen, we know it and we have your back. Unlike other companies who charge an arm and a leg, we only ask for a reasonable fee for any damage caused by accident, liquid, or misuse (price includes parts, labor, and 2-way shipping).

 Made of wheat starch and biodegradable polymers our smartphone case is fully biodegradable. Less garbage, same great smartphone case protection and look.  

Teracube’s dual rear cameras take vivid and sharp pictures. One camera captures the depth of the objects while the second captures vibrant colors and other details.

The front camera utilizes artificial intelligence technology to take beautiful selfies for you to share with your friends, family and the rest of the world.

Most comparable smartphones come with 2GB RAM and 32GB storage. Teracube features 4GB RAM and 64GB storage. If you love playing games, downloading music, storing documents or saving photos, Teracube has plenty of storage for you. A built-in Micro SD slot allows an additional 128GB of storage.

With Teracube’s 4GB RAM, multitasking is now a breeze. Having that extra RAM ensures your Teracube will have great performance for years to come.

 

 

 

*Cricket wireless users in the US might have problem activating the phone. Please read more here.

 

 

The Teracube team is back for its second crowdfunding campaign after a successful first launch on Kickstarter  and Indiegogo last year. We shipped on time and our backers have been happy with their phones. Just take a look at our community! 

When you buy a Teracube 2e, you are part of the family. Check out our online community today at https://community.myteracube.com

Making a positive difference for our environment shouldn't require sacrificing on quality or an amazing phone experience. With Teracube 2e you can have your cake and eat it, too. We're excited to have you join our community. 

 

We're in production and right on schedule! (October 25th)

Risks & Challenges

The team bringing you Teracube has many combined years experience launching consumer electronics and software. To minimize delays, a great deal of the work has already been done before launching on Kickstarter. We have been developing and testing the prototypes for the past 6 months. We have a set of proven partners in both software and hardware engineering for building the phone itself, as well as fulfillment companies for shipping. Last but not least, a contract has been signed with our manufacturing partner which allows us to start production as soon as the campaign completes. There are always certain risks that can arise at any moment during a project like this. That being said, we’re confident in our ability to deliver, and have taken all the necessary measures. The project timeline includes buffers to accommodate parts or manufacturing delays. If anything comes up along the way, you’ll be the first to know. 

 

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make Teracube 2e a reality.

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or purchase a Teracube 2e, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!

story:
What is the Sphere?


What if you could interact with any smart device using your personal style of interaction? What if this was easy to learn, gives you exact control and unlimited possibilities? This is the vision of the Erghis Sphere, a complete re-imagining of touch-free interfaces. As simple as holding a sphere.

ErghisTech is a Swedish startup working on creating a software program that leverages third-party motion sensor data output to simulate an invisible sphere that follows your hands. By using a virtual object instead of discrete gestures it allows you to achieve advanced touchless interaction without a large learning curve. We imagine a future where motion sensors are built into ever smaller computers and you use the Erghis Sphere to control them.

"For the computer this is a set of gestures, for you it is a magical object that gives you unique personalised control."


The Magic of Touch-Free is Here to Stay

An incredible amount of innovation has taken place the last couple of years. Devices that allow your computer to sense and interpret your movements are now a reality. First came the Kinect that enabled you to play games using your body as a controller. Then came the Leap Motion that gives you precision interaction necessary to perform more delicate functions.

The coming years several other technologies are to be released that in different ways provide your computer with eyes and ears. From now on, computers will be able to sense you and your motions. But what will this mean for the way you interact with your devices?


"What if you could use whichever sensor hardware you want and still never need to learn a new style of interaction?"

Currently, each touch-free application uses its own set of gestures, and quite often, different apps use the same gesture to mean different things. To use touchless technologies you'll have to learn each app's particular set of gestures, and the more complicated the interaction, the more gestures you'll have to learn.

This will only get worse as more apps and sensors become available. What if instead you could use whichever sensor hardware you want and still never need to learn a new style of interaction?


"As simple as holding a Sphere": Using third-party sensors, the Erghis Software simulates a Sphere that you can use to control your computer. Many companies are working on touch-free. See a list here.


We at ErghisTech really see the potential in touch-free interaction, and we want to make it as useful as possible. By focussing on developing an easy-to-learn, easy-to-use interface and leaving the sensing hardware to others, we have produced a concept that allows powerful interaction, without making it hard to learn.

How? It’s simple, really. Instead of trying to remember loads of different gestures, just imagine that you’re holding a sphere in your hands. Now gestures like twisting, pulling or tapping the sphere will come naturally. Each of these can then be mapped to a character or command. A visualization of the sphere on your computer display (or through your smart glasses) will show you how it reacts to you. Interacting with your smart devices will no longer feel like it’s being done through a series of gestures, but by manipulating an object in your hands, as if it were actually there.

Use a third-party sensor to detect your hands and the Erghis software to interpret your gestures, and the virtual sphere becomes a powerful yet easy-to-use touch-free interface between you and your smart devices.


Sensor technology will eventually be built into smart-glasses. What if they supported the Sphere? Take a look at some smart glasses here.


The world is at a crossroads. The technology that gives your computer eyes is still too young for big corporations to invest in full interaction systems. There is a historical opportunity to create an interface that is independent democratic and based in people. Help us help you avoid standardized difficult to use and learn gesture systems. Help us to quite literally put touch-free interaction into your hands.


Our Prototype

We wanted to see how people would react to using an imaginary sphere for their computer interaction, so we developed a prototype for Windows: Erghis First. We’ve written this software to support the Leap Motion Controller, a small device that plugs into your computer and creates a 3D interaction space above it. It can track the motion of your hands, and with this tracking data, we’ve been able to implement a basic version of the Sphere. It allows you to write by twisting and tapping the virtual sphere, and move the mouse by grabbing the sphere and pulling it.



We released our early access software in August 2013 and have since been gathering feedback. This is a short video we recorded back then. The early access UI is brought up, made transparent, Hello is written… All of it completely touch-free.



Even though the experience was limited results were amazing, we received a lot of useful feedback via social medias, e-mails and directly on the apps page. One of the first feedbacks we received was:

This is the most feature rich keyboard app that I've tried for the Leap yet. They've done a great job of understanding what the Leap tracks well and implemented a system to work with that tracking. As the tracking improves, I expect this to get better and better over time.

   - A. Harris from Leap Motion, August 23 2013.

But the Sphere is not just about typing in the air. It is about enabling advanced touch-free control for you. Now that we know that one of the most basic of interactions - writing - works we want to take this to the next level. With you help we can!



Using our early access app to write erghis.com into a browser. You can try it out on a Windows PC with a Leap Motion controller via the Airspace Software store.



Erghis First is available to download for anyone via Leap Motion Airspace. Just like there is a software store on your phone - ‘App Store’ on Iphones or ‘Google Play’ on Android - Airspace allows you to purchase software for the Leap Motion Controller. You can find Erghis First and read about how you use it for writing and mouse control here.



Where do we take it from here?

There is much work to be done to achieve the full vision of the Sphere. Our goal with this campaign is to put in place the technological foundation that allows the Sphere to significantly improve with each leap in sensor technology. Here is part of what we are trying to achieve by developing the Sphere.


Democratizing Interaction using Sphere Styles
Make your personal sphere respond to you uniquely, map keys, commands, shortcuts, whole texts or whatever you want to wherever you want it. Your interaction with a machine should be as unique to you as what clothes you wear or what hairstyle you have.

Remove the need for different interfaces on different devices
Ever needed to use a foreign keyboard? Then you can appreciate not needing to do it again. Once you have set-up your Sphere, sync it to Erghis online and use it on any Erghis enabled device wherever your are in the world. If motion sensors get built into different devices this means also using your Sphere on TV:s, tablets, smart glasses and more.

Crossplatform architecture and API
Instead of making your software compatible with each sensor’s API:s on each operating system you want to support use the Erghis API and let it take care of interpreting the sensors. Making your application touch-free enabled should not limit what OS and sensor you work on.

Decouple yourself from your computer
The Sphere is in your hands. Therefore you do not need to find an external object nor sit by the screen of your computer to be able to use it. Sounds incredible? There are sensor technologies under development that can enable this. We want the Sphere to support as many of these as possible.


Our team is small and we have worked hard to bring you Erghis First. We now need your help to implement the features below and take the Sphere to the next level.


Our goal with this campaign is to gain the resources to implement these aspects of the Sphere between august 2014 and august 2015. You can read more about each below.


First Sphere Upgrade
The sphere is an invisible object that follows your hands. Currently it is very simple: it supports writing through twisting, sliding your thumbs and tapping with the rest of your fingers. In the future it will also be able to grow and shrink, spin or be thrown away among other things. It currently supports handling 288 distinct inputs, but by mid 2015 it will be 1188.

Take a complex system, simplify it and make it your own.

Erghis Configurator
The Configurator is a tool to enable your style by easily adjusting the behaviour of the sphere. Put in different characters, whole words or even lines of code in one small movement, or totally change what happens if you twist the sphere. It allows you to create truly unique interaction styles.

Erghis API
The Erghis API will allow developers to hook up or integrate the Erghis Software into their applications; allowing shortcuts, special functions, menus twisting, turning and moving around using the Sphere. There is little need to re-work an application’s original interface, since the Sphere will support interacting with current generation software and will in the long run be available for all operating systems. If you are a software developer save money by leaving touch-free UI design to ErghisTech and maintain focus on your core functionality.


Do you have a third-party application that needs special gestures to be controlled? Is it not enough to manipulate the Sphere? Use the API to allow your users to seamlessly move between the Sphere and your app-specific set of gestures.


Erghis Online
Upload the styles you have created with the configurator and share them with others or take part in current touch-free fashions. Find language settings, application adaptations or just cooler ways of interacting. Forget the days when corporate employees designed keyboard layouts that fit everyone equally but nobody perfectly.

Also this will stop you from ever needing to learn a new keyboard layout again. Go to an Erghis enabled device anywhere, log on and within seconds you will be back to using your own style.

Erghis Interface
The sphere is designed to work without visual feedback once you have learnt it, which frees up your display and in time allows you to move away from your computer. Until then it needs an intuitive way to teach you. When you are a pro it will allow you to use it as a reference in case you feel unsure or want to experiment with new ways of interacting. It will always be there for you when you need it, but never in the way when you don't. The current interface, used in Erghis First, works for teaching interested people to write touch-free. However, as the Sphere gets upgraded the interface needs to be updated with it.

Core Software
Part of the funding for this campaign goes to creating a special software architecture that allows us to keep the Sphere up to date on all platforms simultaneously. This will allow us to implement motion sensor hardware support rapidly. It is important that when using touch-free interaction, it is the same for you on all devices and that a software developer for any OS has the same easy way to integrate with Erghis.


With your support in reaching our goals the Sphere will have its foundations laid. The first personalised Erghis Sphere styles will start to become available on Erghis Online. You will allow us to continue to develop the Sphere more effectively as we can move away from basics and develop the more fantastic aspects of it past mid 2015. Don't stop there. Help us reach our stretch goals below so that the the Sphere gets even better by the end of our project schedule.


Stretch Goals

Each stretch goal we reach enables us to add the below functionality to the Erghis Sphere already by the end of our schedule of mid-2015. 

$40,000

Text-Free Interface
 We want to give you an interface where you don't have to read anything to learn. Such an interface makes the Sphere accessible for everyone across the world independent of their age or language. 

$60,000

Second Sphere Upgrade
The Sphere is currently built around discrete movements. Help us make it understand analog movements as well. Developers can connect API functions to see "how much you twist" the Sphere to create a whole new level of possibilities in customizing the Sphere. Also activate and de-activate the Sphere by growing it between your hands when you need it and throwing it away when you are done.

$80,000

Free the Sphere!
 Just like it sounds. The 'Erghis First' software will be released for free when this goal is achieved. Through updates it will grow into the finished Sphere software. The reason we charge for it currently is to fund the development of the very features we are crowdfunding.

$100,000

Mirror-like 3D-interface
Reaching this target will enable us to hire a dedicated 3D-programmer and artist to make the Sphere come alive in a true 3D interface. This will let you see your hands with the Sphere alive between them onscreen and make learning intuitive and game-like. 

$150,000

OSX or Linux Support by Mid 2015
With the software architecture in place, it will be easy to enable OSX/Linux support, however it will need many months of programming. This stretch goal will allow us to hire extra hands to bring the Sphere to OSX/Linux already by mid 2015. Which OS do you want ported first? Make your voice heard, Vote!

Vote and show your support by selecting Linux Sphere or OSX Sphere here.

$200,000

Both OSX and Linux Support by Mid 2015
This stretch goal will allow us to bring the Sphere to the second of these operating systems.


The People That Bring You the Sphere

ErghisTech is run by Örs-Barna Blénessy  and Holger Andersson. We have varied backgrounds and have worked and lived in several countries before settling in Lund. Here we are studying engineering at Lund University, one of the foremost seats of learning in Europe. Our office is hosted in VentureLab in the Ideon Science Park in Lund. Through it we gain access to all the support available in the innovation system of southern Sweden. Our passion is Innovation through making technology that increases human capacity. Read more about us in the team profiles below the campaign. 

Is that you behind the question mark? The ErghisTech team is looking for talented people. From right to left: Örs-Barna Blénessy, Holger Andersson, Mikaela Färnqvist and Lars Mattiasson.

We turn to crowdfunding because we believe that it is a brilliant way for small start-ups to fund big ideas. This campaign is an effort by Venturelab and The Creative Plot. They are doing it together with us and hope to create a model that can be used to stimulate the growth of start-ups in Sweden.

We are a small start-up with a large vision. The Erghis Sphere seems like something pulled out of a Sci-Fi movie. Yet we know how to make it a reality. The below organizations believe in helping usher in the future of touch-free and support us in different non-monetary ways. 



Get Involved - in Your Style!

Help us lay the initial foundation for the Erghis Sphere. Like the idea of the Sphere? You can support us in different ways:

Share the Vision of Erghis
Share cf.erghis.com and tell your friends about it. Let your friends watch our video and discuss what you see. How do you want the future of interaction to be? Is the sphere your way of doing it or do you prefer something else? What is your style of interaction? 

Find Passionate People We Can Work With
This is Your interaction we are building so you should help shape it. We are looking for those among you who want to contribute not only financially but also with your skills. Discuss, create art work, record sounds, blog for us, write code or make this campaign better. Pitch in, become part of our team and help build the Sphere!

Finance the Sphere
Everything we have said above comes down to you. By donating to this campaign you are making a different future possible. One where interaction between man and machine is shaped by you, not a third party. 



Every Single Dollar Counts

Donate Now


Do you have questions? Maybe we have answered them in our Q&A.

Q & A

Q: What is the Sphere?
A: It is a software interface between you and your computer that uses a third party sensor to interpret you hand movements.The Sphere is an imagined object that helps you to make a great number of different gestures without needing to learn all of them by heart. It is not actually there. When you pretend to rotate the Sphere, the computer registers this using a sensor (such as the Leap Motion Controller) and acts as if there really was a Sphere in your hands. As a result, your computer will perform different actions for you without you having touched it at all.

Q: What can I do with the Sphere?
A: Using the software available today you can type and move the mouse and click things completely touch-free. As ErghisTech develops we will make the Sphere smarter, making it able to understand a myriad of different manipulations. Some examples are twisting, pulling, throwing it. More importantly you will be able to re-configure how the Sphere acts when you perform these actions to truly make computer interaction your own.

Q: How does the Sphere sense movement?
A: It does not. The software relies on you having a third-party sensor to provide it with data about your movements. An example is the Leap Motion Controller.

Q: How will I see the Sphere?
A: You will be able to see the Sphere on your computer’s display with a depiction of your hands holding it.

Q: Do I need to see the Sphere to use it?
A: No, the visualization is purely for learning and reference. As long as you can imagine holding it you will be fine. Once you have learned how the Sphere works, you will be able to use it without feedback - through proprioception.

Q: Propriocep-what?
A: Proprioception is your brain’s ability to know where your body parts are and what they are doing.

Q: Don't I need tactile feedback with touch-free technology?
A: No, your brain was never wired to expect a sense of touch when handling imaginary objects. By seeing your mid-air movements result in actions on the screen and hearing the sounds of the Sphere you will gain enough feedback.

Q: Is it difficult to use?
A: Yes and No. The Sphere is unlike anything you have ever tried before, as such you will need to get used to it. Our in-house tests on our very limited early access software 'Erghis First' has revealed that most people are able to learn how to use it in less than 10 minutes. The longest has been 17 minutes so far. As sensor technology becomes better, this time will decrease significantly. Together with the GUI:s discussed in the campaign above it will become even faster.

Q: What makes the Erghis Sphere easy to learn?
A: Since everyone can imagine holding a sphere, it is very easy to begin. The software will be programmed to display a depiction of your hands on-screen and show you the Sphere. Then simple visual cues on-screen can hint at how you can manipulate it. When you move your hands it instantly reacts and you see the results of your interaction. Essentially, learning from there is like playing a game.

Q: What does the Sphere look like?
A: The Sphere does not exist outside your computer. However, you can select different styles for the appearance of the Sphere on-screen and even design your own. You will be able not just to configure your Sphere’s output but also change its appearance.

Q: Can I use this already today?
A: An 'early access' version of the Sphere is available that allows you to write and control your mouse using a Leap Motion Controller as a sensor. If you have one already you can download the app here. You can get a controller and support developing the Sphere at the same time by selecting it as a reward.

Q: Where can I find this sensor you are talking about?
A: Currently we only support the Leap Motion Controller. You can support our campaign and try out the latest in touch-free by selecting it as a reward in this campaign. If you want to know more about what is coming on the market check out this list.

Q: Why do a Sphere when you could just project a keyboard on a surface?
A: A keyboard on a surface mixes all the problems of a touch-screen keyboard with the ergonomic issues of an actual keyboard. Also your brain expects tactile feedback making the experience feel difficult and unnatural.

Q: I don't see what problem this solves!? Why should I care?
A: As new technology develops that allows better hand and finger tracking, touch-free interaction becomes a more feasible alternative to traditional input methods - especially for portable or wearable smart devices. Currently touch-free interaction is only used for simple commands, but as it becomes more commonly used, the demand for more complex interaction (such as writing) will increase. To meet this demand, there is a need for an interface that’s both easy to learn, and easy to use. The Sphere provides a way of interacting with touch-free enabled devices that allows complex interaction without a steep learning curve.

Q: Will the Sphere support writing in other languages than English?
A: Yes. The Erghis Configurator will allow any kind of input to be mapped to the different taps, twists and squeezes you make on your Sphere.

Q: How can I configure my Sphere?
A: The Erghis Configurator will provide an interface to change the behaviour of your sphere. Configuring it means to adjust sensitivities, change the keymaps’ content, adding custom commands, switching between analog and digital modes and activating/deactivating whole sets of manipulations of the Sphere.

Q: I don't speak English very well, will I be able to use the Erghis Sphere?
A: Eventually you will, yes. We will make a interface free of text that helps you learn visually without the need to read a guide. Speed up development of this by helping us reach our stretch goals.

Q: What are smart glasses and how can the Sphere be used with them?
A: Smart glasses are computers built into glasses. Their tiny size means that interaction with them becomes difficult using traditional touch-based methods. Click here to see some examples of smart glass solutions.

Q: I am an application developer, how would the Erghis Sphere help me?
A: The Erghis Sphere provides a customizable foundation for a touch-free interface. Instead of developing your own set of gestures for your users to learn, you can use the Erghis API to hook your application’s specific functionality into the Sphere. For the users, this means that your application will work in the same way they are used to. For you, it means you don’t have to spend time working on the touch-free interaction; you can focus on the core functionality of your software.

You won’t have to worry about developing for different sensor hardware either. By using the Erghis API, your application will work with any sensor technology supported by the Sphere.
story_txt:
What is the Sphere?
What if you could interact with any smart device using your personal style of interaction? What if this was easy to learn, gives you exact control and unlimited possibilities? This is the vision of the Erghis Sphere, a complete re-imagining of touch-free interfaces. As simple as holding a sphere. 


ErghisTech is a Swedish startup working on creating a software program that leverages third-party motion sensor data output to simulate an invisible sphere that follows your hands. By using a virtual object instead of discrete gestures it allows you to achieve advanced touchless interaction without a large learning curve. We imagine a future where motion sensors are built into ever smaller computers and you use the Erghis Sphere to control them. 

"For the computer this is a set of gestures, for you it is a magical object that gives you unique personalised control."

The Magic of Touch-Free is Here to Stay
An incredible amount of innovation has taken place the last couple of years. Devices that allow your computer to sense and interpret your movements are now a reality. First came the Kinect that enabled you to play games using your body as a controller. Then came the Leap Motion that gives you precision interaction necessary to perform more delicate functions.
The coming years several other technologies are to be released that in different ways provide your computer with eyes and ears. From now on, computers will be able to sense you and your motions. But what will this mean for the way you interact with your devices?
"What if you could use whichever sensor hardware you want and still never need to learn a new style of interaction?"



Currently, each touch-free application uses its own set of gestures, and quite often, different apps use the same gesture to mean different things. To use touchless technologies you'll have to learn each app's particular set of gestures, and the more complicated the interaction, the more gestures you'll have to learn. 
This will only get worse as more apps and sensors become available. What if instead you could use whichever sensor hardware you want and still never need to learn a new style of interaction?
"As simple as holding a Sphere":  Using third-party sensors, the Erghis Software simulates a Sphere that you can  use to control your computer.  Many companies are working on touch-free. See a list here.
We at ErghisTech really see the potential in touch-free interaction, and we want to make it as useful as possible. By focussing on developing an easy-to-learn, easy-to-use interface and leaving the sensing hardware to others, we have produced a concept that allows powerful interaction, without making it hard to learn.
How? It’s simple, really. Instead of trying to remember loads of different gestures, just imagine that you’re holding a sphere in your hands. Now gestures like twisting, pulling or tapping the sphere will come naturally. Each of these can then be mapped to a character or command. A visualization of the sphere on your computer display (or through your smart glasses) will show you how it reacts to you. Interacting with your smart devices will no longer feel like it’s being done through a series of gestures, but by manipulating an object in your hands, as if it were actually there.
Use a third-party sensor to detect your hands and the Erghis software to interpret your gestures, and the virtual sphere becomes a powerful yet easy-to-use touch-free interface between you and your smart devices. 
Sensor technology will eventually be built into smart-glasses. What if they supported the Sphere? Take a look at some smart glasses here.
The world is at a crossroads. The technology that gives your computer eyes is still too young for big corporations to invest in full interaction systems. There is a historical opportunity to create an interface that is independent democratic and based in people. Help us help you avoid standardized difficult to use and learn gesture systems. Help us to quite literally put touch-free interaction into your hands.
Our Prototype

We wanted to see how people would react to using an imaginary sphere for their computer interaction, so we developed a prototype for Windows: Erghis First. We’ve written this software to support the Leap Motion Controller, a small device that plugs into your computer and creates a 3D interaction space above it. It can track the motion of your hands, and with this tracking data, we’ve been able to implement a basic version of the Sphere. It allows you to write by twisting and tapping the virtual sphere, and move the mouse by grabbing the sphere and pulling it. 



We released our early access software in August 2013 and have since been gathering feedback. This is a short video we recorded back then. The early access UI is brought up, made transparent, Hello is written… All of it completely touch-free.



Even though the experience was limited results were amazing, we received a lot of useful feedback via social medias, e-mails and directly on the apps page. One of the first feedbacks we received was: 

This is the most feature rich keyboard app that I've tried for the Leap yet. They've done a great job of understanding what the Leap tracks well and implemented a system to work with that tracking. As the tracking improves, I expect this to get better and better over time.   - A. Harris from Leap Motion, August 23 2013.


But the Sphere is not just about typing in the air. It is about enabling advanced touch-free control for you. Now that we know that one of the most basic of interactions - writing - works we want to take this to the next level. With you help we can!


Using our early access app to write erghis.com into a browser. You can try it out on a Windows PC with a Leap Motion controller via the Airspace Software store.  


Erghis First is available to download for anyone via Leap Motion Airspace. Just like there is a software store on your phone - ‘App Store’ on Iphones or ‘Google Play’ on Android - Airspace allows you to purchase software for the Leap Motion Controller. You can find Erghis First and read about how you use it for writing and mouse control here.




Where do we take it from here?



There is much work to be done to achieve the full vision of the Sphere. Our goal with this campaign is to put in place the technological foundation that allows the Sphere to significantly improve with each leap in sensor technology. Here is part of what we are trying to achieve by developing the Sphere. 



Democratizing Interaction using Sphere Styles

Make your personal sphere respond to you uniquely, map keys, commands, shortcuts, whole texts or whatever you want to wherever you want it. Your interaction with a machine should be as unique to you as what clothes you wear or what hairstyle you have. 

Remove the need for different interfaces on different devices
Ever needed to use a foreign keyboard? Then you can appreciate not needing to do it again. Once you have set-up your Sphere, sync it to Erghis online and use it on any Erghis enabled device wherever your are in the world. If motion sensors get built into different devices this means also using your Sphere on TV:s, tablets, smart glasses and more. 

Crossplatform architecture and API
Instead of making your software compatible with each sensor’s API:s on each operating system  you want to support use the Erghis API and let it take care of interpreting the sensors. Making your application touch-free enabled should not limit what OS and sensor you work on.

Decouple yourself from your computer
The Sphere is in your hands. Therefore you do not need to find an external object nor sit by the screen of your computer to be able to use it. Sounds incredible? There are sensor technologies under development that can enable this. We want the Sphere to support as many of these as possible.

Q: What can I do with the Sphere?
A: Using the software available today you can type and move the mouse and click things completely touch-free. As ErghisTech develops we will make the Sphere smarter, making it able to understand a myriad of different manipulations. Some examples are twisting, pulling, throwing it. More importantly you will be able to re-configure how the Sphere acts when you perform these actions to truly make computer interaction your own.


Q: How does the Sphere sense movement?
A: It does not. The software relies on you having a third-party sensor to provide it with data about your movements. An example is the Leap Motion Controller.


Q: How will I see the Sphere?
A: You will be able to see the Sphere on your computer’s display with a depiction of your hands holding it. 


Q: Do I need to see the Sphere to use it?
A:  No, the visualization is purely for learning and reference. As long as you can imagine holding it you will be fine. Once you have learned how the Sphere works, you will be able to use it without feedback - through proprioception. 


Q: Propriocep-what?
A: Proprioception is your brain’s ability to know where your body parts are and what they are doing. 


Q: Don't I need tactile feedback with touch-free technology?
A: No, your brain was never wired to expect a sense of touch when handling imaginary objects. By seeing your mid-air movements result in actions on the screen and hearing the sounds of the Sphere you will gain enough feedback.


Q: Is it difficult to use?
A: Yes and No. The Sphere is unlike anything you have ever tried before, as such you will need to get used to it. Our in-house tests on our very limited early access software 'Erghis First' has revealed that most people are able to learn how to use it in less than 10 minutes. The longest has been 17 minutes so far. As sensor technology becomes better, this time will decrease significantly. Together with the GUI:s discussed in the campaign above it will become even faster.


Q: What makes the Erghis Sphere easy to learn?
A: Since everyone can imagine holding a sphere, it is very easy to begin. The software will be programmed to display a depiction of your hands on-screen and show you the Sphere. Then simple visual cues on-screen can hint at how you can manipulate it. When you move your hands it instantly reacts and you see the results of your interaction. Essentially, learning from there is like playing a game. 


Q: What does the Sphere look like?
A: The Sphere does not exist outside your computer. However, you can select different styles for the appearance of the Sphere on-screen and even design your own. You will be able not just to configure your Sphere’s output but also change its appearance.


Q: Can I use this already today?
A: An 'early access' version of the Sphere is available that allows you to write and control your mouse using a Leap Motion Controller as a sensor. If you have one already you can download the app here. You can get a controller and support developing the Sphere at the same time by selecting it as a reward.


Q: Where can I find this sensor you are talking about?
A: Currently we only support the Leap Motion Controller. You can support our campaign and try out the latest in touch-free by selecting it as a reward in this campaign. If you want to know more about what is coming on the market check out this list.


Q: Why do a Sphere when you could just project a keyboard on a surface? 
A: A keyboard on a surface mixes all the problems of a touch-screen keyboard with the ergonomic issues of an actual keyboard. Also your brain expects tactile feedback making the experience feel difficult and unnatural.


Q: I don't see what problem this solves!? Why should I care?
A: As new technology develops that allows better hand and finger tracking, touch-free interaction becomes a more feasible alternative to traditional input methods - especially for portable or wearable smart devices. Currently touch-free interaction is only used for simple commands, but as it becomes more commonly used, the demand for more complex interaction (such as writing) will increase. To meet this demand, there is a need for an interface that’s both easy to learn, and easy to use. The Sphere provides a way of interacting with touch-free enabled devices that allows complex interaction without a steep learning curve.
 

Q: Will the Sphere support writing in other languages than English? 
A: Yes. The Erghis Configurator will allow any kind of input to be mapped to the different taps, twists and squeezes you make on your Sphere. 


Q: How can I configure my Sphere?
A: The Erghis Configurator will provide an interface to change the behaviour of your sphere. Configuring it means to adjust sensitivities, change the keymaps’ content, adding custom commands, switching between analog and digital modes and activating/deactivating whole sets of manipulations of the Sphere.


Q: I don't speak English very well, will I be able to use the Erghis Sphere?
A: Eventually you will, yes. We will make a interface free of text that helps you learn visually without the need to read a guide. Speed up development of this by helping    us reach our stretch goals.


Q: What are smart glasses and how can the Sphere be used with them?
A:  Smart glasses are computers built into glasses. Their tiny size means that interaction with them becomes difficult using traditional touch-based methods. Click here to see some examples of smart glass solutions.


Q: I am an application developer, how would the Erghis Sphere help me?
A: The Erghis Sphere provides a customizable foundation for a touch-free interface. Instead of developing your own set of gestures for your users to learn, you can use the Erghis API to hook your application’s specific functionality into the Sphere. For the users, this means that your application will work in the same way they are used to. For you, it means you don’t have to spend time working on the touch-free interaction; you can focus on the core functionality of your software.

You won’t have to worry about developing for different sensor hardware either. By using the Erghis API, your application will work with any sensor technology supported by the Sphere.

story: 123

Summary

With all the Store data breach going on these day ,B-CHECK SYSTEM is the system to help stop these Issues In Current Checkout Terminals.

Our company, B-Check Systems, is in need of a prototype that we can demonstrate the use of our device in stores.

 We seek to provide major security to Data Breach in stores and also the form of a vetted revenue and job creating IT Security System.

  • We are a small group of individual talents with I.T background 
  • Our campaign is to help stop Data Breach at stores and prevent hacker and unauthorized users from stealing card details of customers at the store .
  • By contributing to this project, the system will be created to help enhance security with our store checkout systems whereby stopping wrong people from having access to data.


What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of Seed Funding that will be used as followed:

1. Hardware  $   11,500.00

2. Development $   30, 500.00

3. Patent   $  6,000.00

4. Local Travel and Expense  $  3,000.00

5.  Document Preparation   $  3,500.00

6. Attorney fees  $  3,000.00  

 Grand Total= $57,500.00

Issues In Current Checkout Terminals

Card frauds

  • Use of card duplicators
  • Card sharing by family and friends
  • Inability to trace the wrongful users
  • Hacker gaining access to stores database .

B-Check System solve these issues & offer: 

  • Single/multi factor biometric authentication
  • Multi-factor authentication
  • Card Less Authentication
  • Safe and Secured way to checkout out at the store  

With the prototyped and 1st Round document preparation we will seek traditional and accredited investors at an increased unit value.

We will not use any funds invested unless we can cover the $31,000.00 cost to purchase hardware and to develop

The Impact

We are launching our campaign after seeing the new U.S. Federal Bill passed today (April 5, 2012) that legalized crowd funding. As of January 2012, we have closed compensation deals that have permitted us to put in place an IT Team that have the experience to start and to finish the needed prototype system.

We also have a Plan that we wish to demonstrate to national leaders. We seek to license the B-Check System Application as the digital solution to the U.S Stores data breach crisis.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially assist us with seed funding, then, please share our campaign with others known to you and that you can reach by various social media platforms. You can share our campaign by using  Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
