story:
"From the if you can't beat 'em, join 'em school of product marketing, a new device called RayGo aims to make texting while driving easier and less dangerous."

- Amanda Schupak, CBS NEWS, May 2015.

See the CBS NEWS article and video - Click here


"Texting and driving. We know it's a stupid idea, yet despite all those campaigns against it, some people still think they can handle the demands of a vehicle and their text messages at the same time. And if they're going to continue to do it, there might as well be a product that makes it safer." 


- Simon Cohen, OZY. USA TODAY, May 2015.


RayGo lets you safely use your favorite apps like Messenger, Whatsapp, Gmail, Skype and Pandora while driving or biking. With a bluetooth controller mounted on your steering wheel, and an eye-free user interface, responding to messages becomes as safe and easy as changing radio stations. 



Click here to get our Press Release & Press Kit

With this 5 key Bluetooth controller mounted right on your steering wheel, you’ve got your phone at your fingertips. When you begin driving, the RayGo mobile app senses and automatically converts your favorite apps to DriveMode

DriveMode simplifies your pre-existing apps, such as Whatsapp, Facebook, Skype, WeChat, Gmail, Telephony, SMS Messages, Pandora and Spotify - letting you use your apps, while driving, without ever looking at your phone.

RayGo works on Android only with the following apps:



RayGo DriveMode works in the same simple way that the RAY smartphone for the blind works, letting you control your apps with just 5 keys.

DriveMode is so intuitive and smart that it knows when the driver is busy. It holds back notifications, pauses message playbacks, and even speaks slower when necessary, protecting you from the urge to multi-task, and focusing your attention on the road.

RayGo can be used by right- and left-handed people - The controller can be installed on either left or right sides of the steering wheel and will update the key mappings according to its orientation.


Project RAY is the leading provider of smartphone technology for the blind and visually impaired. Now we bring our sightless patented technology to drivers everywhere, ensuring that RayGo is 100% eyes-free!

RAY smartphone for the blind was created in cooperation with:

Read more about it here


Project RAY was featured in:


Monitoring your speed and location, RayGo adapts its operation to driving conditions; holding back notifications, pausing message playback and even speaking slower when necessary, to ensure that your focus and attention are where they needs to be at any given time.


We are planning special water-proof version of the RayGo controller for bikers. RayGo is not only the safest smartphone solution for drivers, you can also attach RayGo to your bike handles, or even toss your phone into your bag. It will work in the same way, letting you use your apps, while riding your bike, without having to look at your phone.

If you are a biker who thinks that you and other bikers like yourself could benefit from RayGo eyes free solution, Sign up to the RayGo’s Bikers waiting list!! Once we get 500 bikers on the list, we will begin production for the RayGo Bike Edition!

Sign up to the RayGo’s Bikers waiting list: raygo@project-ray.com




Once our Indiegogo campaign closes, you can expect your RayGo to be delivered to wherever you are in the world in just 4 months.

Free Shipping Worldwide!


*RayGo prototype we used for usability testing.


   Founder & CEO

An industry veteran with over 20 years’ experience in high-tech businesses, Boaz’s expertise includes launching high-tech start-up business through to market maturity, strategic and tactical creativity, business development and marketing of telecom technologies and strategic partner negotiations. Boaz is a Co-Founder of fring and worked in the company for six years as Chief Architect responsible for product strategy and partners relations.

  Founder & CTO

Michael has over 18 years of broad software and systems engineering experience starting from working on first experimental 3G systems in Qualcomm. Later on Michael was part of several startups developing products in the areas of wireless chipsets, enterprise networking and Android apps. Michael has multiple patents spanning large-scale mobile communications networks, Bluetooth and WiFi coexistence, secure local wireless networking and innovative user interfaces.

   Founder & Chairman

Arik has over 15 years of management experience in the software and communications market, and over 10 years experience in consulting on both management and technical matters including analysis and design of various computer systems, network security systems, communications systems, high-performance multimedia applications, Internet-enabled applications, command & control, software quality assurance, software and general R&D management. He is experienced in various technical fields including device drivers and system internals, software design and architecture, communications and networking, software project management.


Our mission is to promote responsible use of smartphones on the road. We are expected to stay connected everywhere. Banning smartphones has been already tried, but it clearly doesn't work - We need a smarter solution for responsible use of smartphones in the car.

RayGo is now a fully functional prototype. Become part of the community of RayGo users and pre-order RayGo today! Make an impact by spreading this message to all the people you care about.

Now it’s up to you! Every dollar, Facebook Like, tweet, and mention regarding #RayGo helps you and other drivers like yourself stay connected safely while driving! Back our project and spread the word! Let’s make it happen!


What is DriveMode?

The RayGo mobile app adds DriveMode on-the-fly to popular apps and utilities, making it simple and intuitive to use. DriveMode replaces complex graphics with easy-to-glance-at screens and voice prompts; and replaces touch-screen gestures with simple key presses on the 5-key controller.  This automatic conversion of graphics into linear and common vocal elements is the key factor that enables us to provide intuitive interface for the blind and for drivers.

Which apps can I use with RayGo?

At delivery RayGo will work with Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, Spotify, Gmail, SMS and telephone apps. We will be adding support for more apps in the updates to the RayGo mobile app following the campaign. The top apps on our list are Pandora, Spotify and Skype.

We'd love to hear your suggestions on which app we need to support in the future.

What kinds of apps do not work with RayGo?

RayGo will not support apps that create a significant visual distraction, for example games, video apps (e.g. YouTube), and picture apps (e.g. Camera, Instagram, Snapchat.)

What are the voice control functions RayGo provides?

You can control your apps using just 5 keys of the RayGo controller. That includes responding to your messages with pre-defined quick responses (don't forget your main task is driving!) If you cannot delay sending a longer message, you can send a recorded audio message or use voice recognition. When sending recorded audio message, the recipient will hear your voice as recorded by the smartphone. When using voice recognition, your smartphone will translate your voice into a text string before sending the message to the recipient. 

I already have an app that stops me from texting. Why is RayGo better?

RayGo is not a product for those who already found the way to avoid using their smartphones while driving. This is certainly the best and safest way to keep your full attention to the road.    RayGo is a product for the many of us who use their phones even though we know it’s wrong, providing a much safer way to engage with your smartphone while driving.

I like to glance at my phone when I am using a navigation app. Will I be able to see the map in DriveMode?

When you need to look at your phone, and a navigation app is a good example for it, you can proactively activate the screen by pressing the hot key (long press on the center button) on the RayGo steering-wheel controller. The screen is left open for 2 seconds which is the recommended time limit for visual distractions.

When can I expect my pre-ordered RayGo?

Once our campaign is successfully funded, you can expect your RayGo within 4 months of the campaign’s completion

Which smartphones does RayGo work with?

Any Android device running OS version 4.1 and above

Does RayGo work with iPhone?

Currently, we offer limited support to iPhone users that include reading aloud notifications. We are working on better adapting RayGo for the iPhone, and the full version should be available in the next six months.

How does the controller connect to my phone?

The controller connects to your smartphone over a standard Bluetooth connection.

How does RayGo know when how I am speeding up or slowing down?

The RayGo mobile app receives updates on the device’s speed from sensors on the RayGo controller and the smartphone. so we can evaluate whether it is safe to interrupt a user with a notification.

Does RayGo come in different colors?

We evaluated different color schemes aiming to design a device that can blend in car interiors while still being fresh and modern. Dark grey with lime yellow worked best in our tests. We are open to considering additional color schemes suggested by you in the comments.

I have more questions. Who can I ask?

Please leave a comment on the COMMENT tab at the top of the page, or email us at raygo@project-ray.com and we will reply as soon as possible
story_txt:
"From the if you can't beat 'em, join 'em school of product marketing, a new device called RayGo aims to make texting while driving easier and less dangerous."

- Amanda Schupak, CBS NEWS, May 2015.




See the CBS NEWS article and video - Click here

"Texting and driving. We know it's a stupid idea, yet despite all those campaigns against it, some people still think they can handle the demands of a vehicle and their text messages at the same time. And if they're going to continue to do it, there might as well be a product that makes it safer." 
- Simon Cohen, OZY. USA TODAY, May 2015.





 




RayGo lets you safely use your favorite apps like Messenger, Whatsapp, Gmail, Skype and Pandora while driving or biking. With a bluetooth controller mounted on your steering wheel, and an eye-free user interface, responding to messages becomes as safe and easy as changing radio stations. 



Click here to get our Press Release & Press Kit




With this 5 key Bluetooth controller mounted right on your steering wheel, you’ve got your phone at your fingertips. When you begin driving, the RayGo mobile app senses and automatically converts your favorite apps to DriveMode





DriveMode simplifies your pre-existing apps, such as Whatsapp, Facebook, Skype, WeChat, Gmail, Telephony, SMS Messages, Pandora and Spotify - letting you use your apps, while driving, without ever looking at your phone.

RayGo works on Android only with the following apps:



















RayGo DriveMode works in the same simple way that the RAY smartphone for the blind works, letting you control your apps with just 5 keys.


DriveMode is so intuitive and smart that it knows when the driver is busy. It holds back notifications, pauses message playbacks, and even speaks slower when necessary, protecting you from the urge to multi-task, and focusing your attention on the road. 
RayGo can be used by right- and left-handed people - The controller can be installed on either left or right sides of the steering wheel and will update the key mappings according to its orientation.







Project RAY is the leading provider of smartphone technology for the blind and visually impaired. Now we bring our sightless patented technology to drivers everywhere, ensuring that RayGo is 100% eyes-free!


RAY smartphone for the blind was created in cooperation with:




Read more about it here

Project RAY was featured in:





Monitoring your speed and location, RayGo adapts its operation to driving conditions; holding back notifications, pausing message playback and even speaking slower when necessary, to ensure that your focus and attention are where they needs to be at any given time.






We are planning special water-proof version of the RayGo controller for bikers. RayGo is not only the safest smartphone solution for drivers, you can also attach RayGo to your bike handles, or even toss your phone into your bag. It will work in the same way, letting you use your apps, while riding your bike, without having to look at your phone.




If you are a biker who thinks that you and other bikers like yourself could benefit from RayGo eyes free solution, Sign up to the RayGo’s Bikers waiting list!! Once we get 500 bikers on the list, we will begin production for the RayGo Bike Edition!




Sign up to the RayGo’s Bikers waiting list: raygo@project-ray.com












Once our Indiegogo campaign closes, you can expect your RayGo to be delivered to wherever you are in the world in just 4 months.
Free Shipping Worldwide! 







*RayGo prototype we used for usability testing.









   Founder & CEO
An industry veteran with over 20 years’ experience in high-tech businesses, Boaz’s expertise includes launching high-tech start-up business through to market maturity, strategic and tactical creativity, business development and marketing of telecom technologies and strategic partner negotiations. Boaz is a Co-Founder of fring and worked in the company for six years as Chief Architect responsible for product strategy and partners relations.




  Founder & CTO
Michael has over 18 years of broad software and systems engineering experience starting from working on first experimental 3G systems in Qualcomm. Later on Michael was part of several startups developing products in the areas of wireless chipsets, enterprise networking and Android apps. Michael has multiple patents spanning large-scale mobile communications networks, Bluetooth and WiFi coexistence, secure local wireless networking and innovative user interfaces.



   Founder & Chairman
Arik has over 15 years of management experience in the software and communications market, and over 10 years experience in consulting on both management and technical matters including analysis and design of various computer systems, network security systems, communications systems, high-performance multimedia applications, Internet-enabled applications, command & control, software quality assurance, software and general R&D management. He is experienced in various technical fields including device drivers and system internals, software design and architecture, communications and networking, software project management.





Our mission is to promote responsible use of smartphones on the road. We are expected to stay connected everywhere. Banning smartphones has been already tried, but it clearly doesn't work - We need a smarter solution for responsible use of smartphones in the car.
RayGo is now a fully functional prototype. Become part of the community of RayGo users and pre-order RayGo today! Make an impact by spreading this message to all the people you care about.
Now it’s up to you! Every dollar, Facebook Like, tweet, and mention regarding #RayGo helps you and other drivers like yourself stay connected safely while driving! Back our project and spread the word! Let’s make it happen!









What is DriveMode?
The RayGo mobile app adds DriveMode on-the-fly to popular apps and utilities, making it simple and intuitive to use. DriveMode replaces complex graphics with easy-to-glance-at screens and voice prompts; and replaces touch-screen gestures with simple key presses on the 5-key controller.  This automatic conversion of graphics into linear and common vocal elements is the key factor that enables us to provide intuitive interface for the blind and for drivers.

Which apps can I use with RayGo?
At delivery RayGo will work with Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, Spotify, Gmail, SMS and telephone apps. We will be adding support for more apps in the updates to the RayGo mobile app following the campaign. The top apps on our list are Pandora, Spotify and Skype.
We'd love to hear your suggestions on which app we need to support in the future.

What kinds of apps do not work with RayGo?
RayGo will not support apps that create a significant visual distraction, for example games, video apps (e.g. YouTube), and picture apps (e.g. Camera, Instagram, Snapchat.)

What are the voice control functions RayGo provides?
You can control your apps using just 5 keys of the RayGo controller. That includes responding to your messages with pre-defined quick responses (don't forget your main task is driving!) If you cannot delay sending a longer message, you can send a recorded audio message or use voice recognition. When sending recorded audio message, the recipient will hear your voice as recorded by the smartphone. When using voice recognition, your smartphone will translate your voice into a text string before sending the message to the recipient. 

I already have an app that stops me from texting. Why is RayGo better?RayGo is not a product for those who already found the way to avoid using their smartphones while driving. This is certainly the best and safest way to keep your full attention to the road.    RayGo is a product for the many of us who use their phones even though we know it’s wrong, providing a much safer way to engage with your smartphone while driving.


I like to glance at my phone when I am using a navigation app. Will I be able to see the map in DriveMode?
When you need to look at your phone, and a navigation app is a good example for it, you can proactively activate the screen by pressing the hot key (long press on the center button) on the RayGo steering-wheel controller. The screen is left open for 2 seconds which is the recommended time limit for visual distractions.

When can I expect my pre-ordered RayGo?
Once our campaign is successfully funded, you can expect your RayGo within 4 months of the campaign’s completion

Which smartphones does RayGo work with?
Any Android device running OS version 4.1 and above
Does RayGo work with iPhone?
Currently, we offer limited support to iPhone users that include reading aloud notifications. We are working on better adapting RayGo for the iPhone, and the full version should be available in the next six months.
How does the controller connect to my phone?
The controller connects to your smartphone over a standard Bluetooth connection.
How does RayGo know when how I am speeding up or slowing down?
The RayGo mobile app receives updates on the device’s speed from sensors on the RayGo controller and the smartphone. so we can evaluate whether it is safe to interrupt a user with a notification.
Does RayGo come in different colors?
We evaluated different color schemes aiming to design a device that can blend in car interiors while still being fresh and modern. Dark grey with lime yellow worked best in our tests. We are open to considering additional color schemes suggested by you in the comments.
I have more questions. Who can I ask?
Please leave a comment on the COMMENT tab at the top of the page, or email us at raygo@project-ray.com and we will reply as soon as possible

story:
Many fear the government but the government still fears many. It fears that educated and empowered few who are willing to say enough and act. It fears the open minded. It fears you. Put some time to take action and be part of something important. The restoration of our freedom.  

Privacy: noun pri·va·cy\ˈprī-və-sē  Freedom from damaging publicity, public scrutiny, secret surveillance, or unauthorized disclosure of one's personal data or informaiton, as by a government, corporation, or individual.

We have entered an age of endangered privacy, where surveillance of our actions and exchanges as citizens is absolute. You can protect yourself.

Introducing the Anoncom models 4G (LTE),  4G+ Beta, and X6, installed with cutting edge software to keep your encrypted communications private. All models are installed with a full security package of encryption and privacy technology. 

With your help, we will be able to offer the public affordable configured private encrypted smart phones that protect their right to privacy. Open and sincere communication is a fundamental component of free societies where true democracy and peace can flourish. 

You are the movement, and this is your tool.

The Anonymist or The Survivalist? 

The anonymist is a sleek, and powerful AnonCom 4G LTE. Incredible performance for the most demanding user, offering a powerful suite of privacy protection on an encrypted Android KitKat system. 

With fingerprint scanning built in, you can control access not only to your encrypted phone, but also to individual applications and archives. 

The survivalist is the perfect marriage between the strongest physical protection available with the strongest digital protection available.The AnonCom X6 is perfect for the adventurer, ready to keep up with you in the toughest environments while protecting your most sensitive data. For those who want extreme protection from all the elements both physical and digital, the AnonCom X6 is it.

The AnonCom configuration has been tested and proven itself in the field. Through IndieGoGo we are delivering the ultimate combination with excellent cameras, large vivid screens with high resolution, huge batteries, fast processors, and massive storage expandable up to 128GB (with optional microSD or microSDHC). With the AnonCom 4G to make high performance privacy and security affordable for everyone, or with the AnonCom X6, you are ready for the toughest challenges. 

"Ordinary citizens, working together, can change the world" ~Edward Snowden


Even a password protected cell phone is easily accessed by anyone who wants the information within. Remembering that even deleted files and photos are still lurking on your phone, how will you feel when those files became public? 

Nine of 10 account holders found in a large cache of intercepted conversations which former NSA contractor Edward Snowden provided, were not the intended surveillance targets but were caught in the net the agency had cast. There are more than 1.2 million people on various stages of the NSA watch list. 

Private Anonymous Communications  

AnonCom uses Curve25519, AES-256, and HMAC-SHA256. The security of these algorithms has been tested over many years of use in hundreds of different applications. Messages sent via text are end-to-end encrypted, which means that they can only be read by your intended recipients. We make it easy for you to verify that you are communicating with the right people and that no MITM attack has occurred. The keys that are used to encrypt your messages are stored on your device alone, and they are protected by an additional layer of encryption if you have a passphrase enabled. No one has access to the contents of any messages sent by users. The Axolotl ratchet is the most advanced cryptographic ratchet available. Axolotl ensures that new AES keys are used for every single message, and it provides text messaging with both forward secrecy and future secrecy properties. The messaging protocol also features enhanced deniability properties that improve on those provided by OTR, except unlike OTR all of these features work well in an asynchronous mobile environment.  

"AnonCom strives to deliver the current state of the art in secure mobile communications."  


Making secure calls When making a call you're first authenticated by one the authentication servers and then a relay server handles connecting you to the call recipient. All of these communications are encrypted. Since the caller isn't directly connected to the recipient (most you need NAT traversal on mobile data networks), your provider isn't able to know who you're talking to. They could estimate out how long was the conversation, but they're not able to know the recipient or the content. 

Private Internet Browsing 

The anonymous private browser assigns users an anonymous IP address that makes them virtually untraceable to chat with other anonymous users and surf the web. It prevents websites from tracking or logging your activities. It is the most secure browser for Android by automatically clearing cookies, histories, encrypting all in/out data, and assigning you a new IP address that cannot be tracked back to your phone or carrier.

* Blocks sites affected by HeartBleed OpenSSL bug (performs ssl check) 
* Disabled Location Services for higher security (websites cannot snoop your location) 
* Full screen immersive mode 
* No ROOT or Plugins required 
* YouTube video support 
* Tabbed browsing 
* Desktop and Mobile Rendering 
* Flash Support (install flash.apk separately from Adobe) - but not recommended. 
* Encrypted Proxy

Private encrypted email

Free and secure email service that works like any other standard email service (gmail,yahoo mail,etc.etc.), with the addition of a state of the art encryption and electronic signature to your messages and attachments. It is extremely user friendly, the 4096 bit RSA encryption keys and the signature are automatically generated. 


Performance of the future

AnonCom X6 has a super mighty 1.5 GHz quad core processor which provides the highest speed and smoothness while running any kinds of tasks. In addition, the phone has 2 GB of system memory and 32 GB of built in storage. The smartphone runs on a latest Android 4.2 operating system. These features are even more than what is needed for spaceships to be launched.

The AnonCom 4G LTE has an amazing 1.7Ghz Octa Core processor, 2GB of system memory with 16 GB of built in storage running the Android 4.4 operating system.  

Two super cameras

With the AnonCom X6 we left behind the principles of primary and secondary cameras. From now on, both rear and front cameras are 13 megapixels. As a result, the pictures have 3264x2448 pixels resolution and the videos can be shot with full HD resolution. With all that, the smartphone can be used as a real photo or video camera. With the SpyKit installed, motion detection surveillance, time lapse photography, and can even be triggered by SMS messaging. 

The AnonCom 4G has the 13 megapixel main rear camera, but the secondary front camera is only 8 megapixel. 

Phenomenal display

At 5" diagonally, IPS matrix with 16 millions of colors display with Full HD 1080 x 1920 pixels, 24 bit resolution that is the highest resolution among all the rugged smartphones. All these features deliver a super high quality of display with third generation Corning Gorilla Glass. 

Superhero protection

The AnonCom X6 is IP67 certified which means that the phone is dust and waterproof and can be submerged into water on the depth of one and a half meter for 30 minutes. Smart design, high quality materials and high-level of detail in assembly provide the phone with an unmatched durability and survivability. 

The AnonCom 4G is not waterproof.

Extraordinary connection

With the support of two sim cards AnonCom X6 can run both of them in 3G standard. In addition, the smartphone has built in walkie-talkie which works on 400-480 MHz frequencies and with a range of up to 10 kilometers.

The AnonCom 4G is limited to 4G in the primary sim card.

Super capacious battery

The AnonCom X6 has impressive 4200 mAh Lithium-polymer battery, which is more than enough for continuous work.

The AnonCom 4G has a massive 3150 mAh Li-ion battery.

They could estimate out how long was the conversation, but they're not able to know the recipient or the content.  Private Internet Browsing The anonymous private browser assigns users an anonymous IP address that makes them virtually untraceable to chat with other anonymous users and surf the web. It prevents websites from tracking or logging your activities. It is the most secure browser for Android by automatically clearing cookies, histories, encrypting all in/out data, and assigning you a new IP address that cannot be tracked back to your phone or carrier.* Blocks sites affected by HeartBleed OpenSSL bug (performs ssl check) * Disabled Location Services for higher security (websites cannot snoop your location) * Full screen immersive mode * No ROOT or Plugins required * YouTube video support * Tabbed browsing * Desktop and Mobile Rendering * Flash Support (install flash.apk separately from Adobe) - but not recommended. * Encrypted ProxyPrivate encrypted emailFree and secure email service that works like any other standard email service (gmail,yahoo mail,etc.etc.), with the addition of a state of the art encryption and electronic signature to your messages and attachments. It is extremely user friendly, the 4096 bit RSA encryption keys and the signature are automatically generated. Performance of the futureAnonCom X6 has a super mighty 1.5 GHz quad core processor which provides the highest speed and smoothness while running any kinds of tasks. In addition, the phone has 2 GB of system memory and 32 GB of built in storage. The smartphone runs on a latest Android 4.2 operating system. These features are even more than what is needed for spaceships to be launched.The AnonCom 4G LTE has an amazing 1.7Ghz Octa Core processor, 2GB of system memory with 16 GB of built in storage running the Android 4.4 operating system.   Two super camerasWith the AnonCom X6 we left behind the principles of primary and secondary cameras. From now on, both rear and front cameras are 13 megapixels. As a result, the pictures have 3264x2448 pixels resolution and the videos can be shot with full HD resolution. With all that, the smartphone can be used as a real photo or video camera. With the SpyKit installed, motion detection surveillance, time lapse photography, and can even be triggered by SMS messaging.  The AnonCom 4G has the 13 megapixel main rear camera, but the secondary front camera is only 8 megapixel. Phenomenal displayAt 5" diagonally, IPS matrix with 16 millions of colors display with Full HD 1080 x 1920 pixels, 24 bit resolution that is the highest resolution among all the rugged smartphones. All these features deliver a super high quality of display with third generation Corning Gorilla Glass.   Superhero protectionThe AnonCom X6 is IP67 certified which means that the phone is dust and waterproof and can be submerged into water on the depth of one and a half meter for 30 minutes. Smart design, high quality materials and high-level of detail in assembly provide the phone with an unmatched durability and survivability.   The AnonCom 4G is not waterproof.Extraordinary connectionWith the support of two sim cards AnonCom X6 can run both of them in 3G standard. In addition, the smartphone has built in walkie-talkie which works on 400-480 MHz frequencies and with a range of up to 10 kilometers. The AnonCom 4G is limited to 4G in the primary sim card.Super capacious batteryThe AnonCom X6 has impressive 4200 mAh Lithium-polymer battery, which is more than enough for continuous work.The AnonCom 4G has a massive 3150 mAh Li-ion battery. AnonCom X6 Quick story:
What it Does - How it Works - Technical Details - Our History - About Us - Goals - Bottom Line - Risks & Challenges - FAQs - Photos

What it does

We help you to hide your true location, to anonymize your online activity, and to thwart others on your network (or your ISP or government agencies) from knowing what you are doing online.  This is especially useful for activists, newspaper reporters, NGOs, corporate executives, families, and any individual concerned with privacy.

We operate on the principle that, not only must Gordian be totally secure and reliable, but that it ought to do what people need! You can pop Gordian in your bag at the coffee shop and instantly (and wirelessly) connect to a hotspot from your phone, tablet, or laptop. Gordian will run for hours on an inexpensive USB power pack.


KEY FEATURES (what sets us apart):

  • Captive portal & hotspot friendly 
    Gordian allows users to accept public hotspot terms and/or authenticate with captive portals, which is not possible with other privacy solutions. 
  • Connect to wired and wireless Internet connections
    Gordian supports hotspots, cafes, airports, hotels, offices, home routers,  or any Internet source
  • All your devices can connect wirelessly or via wired networking
    Gordian creates a secure wireless network which supports computers, mobile devices. Network appliances can also connect via the wired connection.
  • Intuitive & responsive computer and mobile-friendly user experience
    Gordian's interface is easy to use in any browser and on any OS (iPhone and Android-friendly).

  • Fails safe & secure while surfing anonymously
    All application traffic is funneled through an anonymous proxy, even from applications that do not support proxies; if the anonymous proxy fails for some reason, you can be assured that no traffic will pass through.

How it works


The secret sauce:

Gordian is a secure gateway for all communications emanating from a user's personal electronic device. Whether destined for the Internet or a corporate intranet these communications are immediately encrypted and tunneled over the anonymizing network called Tor where they pass through many other Tor users' devices before eventually travelling over the Internet to those communications' destinations.

Because of how Tor encrypts communications and disguises communications' sources and destinations, neither others on the same public network nor ISPs nor other users of Tor (not even governments) can view what you are doing on the Internet. Even the websites and services you access while using Gordian cannot locate or identify you (unless you provide your location or identifying information to them). Used in conjunction with clearing your web browser's cookies frequently, this greatly increases privacy, protecting the integrity of communications with correspondents and protecting against stalking, to name just a few of the benefits.

Using a hardware privacy and anonymity solution like ours is more effective than running Tor on your own computer or device, because it ensures all applications' network/Internet communications are routed through the Tor network, which helps protect against known side channel weaknesses common with using Tor and provides plug-and-play privacy and anonymity for the masses regardless of technological ability.

Connection options:

** This is already an implemented and well-tested feature of Gordian.                            


Technical details:

Our firmware unlocks a massively important feature set, and we are working with partners to pair it with the best hardware components in the long term. In the future, we’d like to build custom hardware… but we’re in the firmware business, and the best way for us to get that to the world is to ship it on preexisting hardware which we have thoroughly tested and that we trust. This gives users (from the least tech-savvy to seasoned hackers) automatic use of the Tor anonymity network on a very secure device. Our firmware utilizes some great tried and true open source software components, including OpenWRT, Tor, etc.. We built the entire user interface from the ground up to provide a simplified workflow designed to be used by people of most any technological ability (currently available in English exclusively).

Our prototypes are already leaps and bounds ahead of competition in functionality and efficiency. Our team is working diligently to perfect and test the newest and most revolutionary feature of Gordian: FULL WIRELESS OPERATION! 


Oh no, another Tor-enabled router! (Our History)

We started our project years ago (circa 2011) and slowly and steadily made progress toward a foolproof usable privacy solution. Initial prototypes were large, clunky, ugly, and consumed power like a hungry baboon loves chocolate cake. What we needed were smaller, cheaper, more capable, and more power efficient hardware so we could continue with what we do best---hacking, packaging, and improving user experience. What we needed was what the future provided---inexpensive travel routers, SoCs, and infinite possibilities! That future is now.

In addition to our years of testing out new and newer devices as potential hardware vehicles for a practical, usable, portable, plug-and-play Tor-enabled gateway, we also watched as many Tor-enabled router projects came and went, most for wired-only connectivity, and all with the same critical flaws---their inability to handle the three really important scenarios:

  • Acting as a wireless client to connect to wireless networks for Internet access (needed in many cafes, restaurants, hotels, and airports)
  • Support for captive portals and hotspots
  • Support mobile phones, tablets, and devices without Ethernet ports by simultaneously acting as a secured wireless access point and a wireless client

What sets our project apart from our older cousins? Gordian does all that right out of the box! And with a super-simple interface that doesn't require users to write a single line of code.

Oh, yeah, and.. we've just spent the last 11 months testing it out everywhere from fast food restaurants to coffeehouses to college campuses. 

We'll never look at french fries the same ever again...


What do we know, anyway? (About Us)

We are a team from a variety of research, development, and business backgrounds, living and loving life in a highly-innovative college town near four universities.

Our team consists of 11 individuals (and rapidly growing!) who not only believe in this product, but who also have years of experience:

  • researching the usable security and privacy problems
  • researching and modeling networks and network security
  • writing software and firmware that run on devices (embedded Linux and microcontrollers alike)
  • running successful businesses and NGOs
  • managing financial assets exceeding $1.5 million USD
  • developing marketing strategies for Fortune 500 firms
  • producing award-winning photography and videography projects
  • customer service management and order fulfillment


How will backers' money be used? (Our Goals)

After we allocate finances to fulfill the rewards we've listed for various support amounts (it's our first obligation!) a good portion of the funds you donate will go toward hardware/merchandise and shipping costs. Then, tentatively but subject to change, remaining funds will be applied to the development costs associated with the following goals. So before moving forward with design and innovation, we will fulfill the rewards we've listed for each level of giving. 

It is important to note that each Gordian device we deliver through this Indiegogo campaign will be a fully functional beta-device. We will have put the hardware and firmware through rigorous testing. Building on the foundation laid by our Indiegogo supporters, we will continue to innovate our firmware and work toward developing a custom enclosure with additional functionality (think a slimmer profile). We're in this for the long haul, and we firmly believe Gordian should be thoughtfully designed as well as practically useful.

BRIEFLY: We did the math, and every 1000 devices we produce could require upwards of 250 person-hours (man-hours) for assembly/QA/handling, plus shipping costs.  It's also quite difficult to staff full-time employees on a temporary basis. These factors could contribute the greatest to costs associated with fulfilling our rewards, and we've set our various reward price points to maximize our ability to follow through.

  • Strengthen core feature set mentioned above
  • Improve user experience even more (we have a lot of ideas to implement in the interface.)
  • Further testing in many different environments (even internationally)
  • Foster a community of users to support one another; Anything related to Tor involves community, and we love that.
  • Develop ability to auto-update firmware (in a secure manner)
  • Communicate with the utmost transparency and honesty
  • Build a comprehensive brand and a strong web-presence (website)
  • Develop marketing strategies (positioning and market research)
  • Setup shipping structure for worldwide delivery
  • Create a marketplace for promoting innovative usable security and privacy services to help people locate them and become educated about their usefulness

If our funding goal is exceeded, we will look into applying a portion of the funds toward developing (which could include hiring) several of our long-term stretch goals, including but not limited to the following list. Of course, stretch goals are not guaranteed within this campaign, but are intended to give potential backers a brain-dump---a glimpse of our broader vision and desires related to our project's focus, things that we think would be cool to see.

Stretch Goals:

  • Building much-needed secure/private/anonymous services that are easy to use (and inherently safe to access through our firmware)
  • Promoting secure-by-design and private-by-design software through improving usability, user experience, support, and education---getting today's best protection into the hands of everyone
  • Researching and developing secure/private/anonymous Cloud services, as well as completely decentralized peer-to-peer products that auto-scale, can never be monitored, and can never be shut down
  • Developing firmware/feature enhancements based upon user feedback
  • Possibly building meaningful partnerships with like-minded projects and developers
  • Possibly exploring additional future hardware options, depending upon funds, potential ROI, and user feedback
  • Networking efforts with individuals, organizations, NGOs, non-profits, journalists, and even foreign governments who are concerned about their privacy to help us cater solutions to their needs
  • Support for RADIUS or WPA Enterprise 

The bottom line

Goal of this project: We'd love your support in enabling us to do what we do best: creatively pair components, refine user experience, and get a safer-to-use Tor solution into the hands of everyday human beings in the form of a super-portable router preconfigured to run Tor which can (with our innovative firmware solutions) support captive portals and hotspots. To the best of our knowledge, this is something that no one has ever accomplished before!

Vision of our company: We believe our approach is uniquely positioned to be a game changer in how everyone from road warrior designers to Fortune 500 executives enjoys affordable and reliable Internet security. If in the long run all we do is increase awareness of Tor and create momentum in usable security and privacy demand and development (even for projects or businesses other than our own) we'll be able to sleep at night; however, with your support, we might possibly be able to position our company as an industry influencer with many other usable security and privacy projects to come!


Risks & Challenges

We have been working with a hardware manufacturer for our developmental prototype Gordian already, and this manufacturer has promised to be able to provide enough units for us to fulfill our rewards to our Indiegogo supporters within a reasonable time frame. (We are interested in finding a backup manufacturer too, just in case.)

Because simultaneous wireless network and wireless device connections, as well as simultaneous wired network and wired device connections, are both new features we have just implemented, we will need to perform further testing prior to shipment and they are the most likely culprits for potential bugs. We have noticed in tests that, upon initially connecting to a wireless network when using the simultaneous wireless network and wireless device connectivity (fully-wireless operation), some personal devices seem to briefly disconnect and reconnect to the wireless access point provided by Gordian---this does not seem to prevent the Gordian from being usable, but we hope to find ways to improve this experience while performing further testing.

Those who pledge support and receive one or more Gordian units should consider the devices they receive to be an initial public beta version of the Gordian router.  As with any beta device, there is the potential for limitations that will be improved upon in future versions of the device based upon user feedback.

Wireless network connections (including WPA/WPA2 Personal, but not including RADIUS or WPA Enterprise yet) with wired personal device connections are well-tested and working quite well, in our opinion.

Our Gordian router makes use of the third-party Tor anonymity network; as such, it is subject to the performance overhead and other constraints associated with the use of Tor.


FAQs


Why don’t you _____________?

We’re hoping to have feedback from people like you who influence Gordian’s development, because we want Gordian to solve the real needs of people just like you.  If you don’t see a response to your question in the other FAQs (below) then please ask us! 

How do we know you’re not influenced by the government and have built a backdoor into your device?

Unlike many indiegogo projects we are actually an incorporated entity, and we have built various canaries* into our platform which indicate we have not NOT been forced by any government agencies to compromise user: security, privacy, financials, locations.

*in this application, a canary is a regularly-posted notification which states that we haven’t received any court orders. One of ours looks like this. 

What security expertise do you have that enabled you to develop this device?

Our team is comprised of a number of people who bring different skills and experience to the table, but the primary development of our firmware was spearheaded by a published PhD student and former adjunct instructor whose research focused on usable security solutions.

Why should people trust you?

We intend our video explanations to provide some ethos and help build trust. And we desire to further simplify and improve Internet privacy; we have clearly stated our vision and we think it’s something many people will get behind.

The digital age is full of huge potential for good but without intentional effort we may sacrifice more privacy than we’d like. Gordian has the potential to deliver the best of Tor (anonymity and security) with greater convenience than ever before.

Why has it taken you four years to build "another" Tor router?

Our project originally started as a solution to a specific need by a specific NGO performing work abroad, where they were concerned with privacy and security on public networks. Initial prototypes were much larger due to a different hardware platform that we used for development at the time. It wasn’t until recently that a public awareness and resulting need arose, which also led to us adopting a recently-available hardware platform that is much smaller than our original prototypes.

Why have you chosen a flexible funding campaign (rather than fixed), and why Indiegogo?

Originally we did approach Kickstarter; they were interested in us releasing Gordian as a software solution to run on a variety of platforms. But as Gordian is a combination of software components, much of which is very hardware specific (firmware and drivers), we decided rather than compromise the integrity of the project or haggle with Kickstarter, we would move our campaign to Indiegogo – which we’ve found to be a solid and successful platform. And we decided to go with flexible funding because we have big hopes for this project which go beyond shipping some devices, but we don’t need to reach a particular critical mass to begin shipping beta devices.

Are you hosting your project on Github where people can parse the code etc? And will you be open sourcing the software and hardware in time? 

With Gordian not being a single piece of software (but a combination of multiple bits of firmware, drivers, settings, and even a web server) and also a minimum viable product, at this point we think going open source would be confusing. (A very dynamic amalgamation is difficult to just throw up on Github). Ultimately, we don’t have an issue opening our source and may well do so, but at this point we don’t see it as all that helpful. 

There are many Tor enabled routers, why should people want yours?

That’s simple, Gordian is the only totally wireless client of its kind available in the world!

While the basic concept has been around in security circles for a while, the simplicity of this solution is what’s next generation.

For this reason, Gordian is truly unique, and we’re excited about it. But our vision goes beyond a device sitting next to someone’s computer, our vision concerns Internet privacy and security as a whole. We’re excited about Tor and bringing it to the next level—Gordian has the potential to bring many more users to the network which will actually improve the anonymity for other users. Furthermore, we dream of software solutions that exist within or are built upon the Tor network, such as truly secure peer to peer messaging and possibly even business solutions as well.

Back to the top

The secret sauce:Gordian is a secure gateway for all communications emanating from a user's personal electronic device. Whether destined for the Internet or a corporate intranet these communications are immediately encrypted and tunneled over the anonymizing network called Tor where they pass through many other Tor users' devices before eventually travelling over the Internet to those communications' destinations.Because of how Tor encrypts communications and disguises communications' sources and destinations, neither others on the same public network nor ISPs nor other users of Tor (not even governments) can view what you are doing on the Internet. Even the websites and services you access while using Gordian cannot locate or identify you (unless you provide your location or identifying information to them). Used in conjunction with clearing your web browser's cookies frequently, this greatly increases privacy, protecting the integrity of communications with correspondents and protecting against stalking, to name just a few of the benefits.Using a hardware privacy and anonymity solution like ours is more effective than running Tor on your own computer or device, because it ensures all applications' network/Internet communications are routed through the Tor network, which helps protect against known side channel weaknesses common with using Tor and provides plug-and-play privacy and anonymity for the masses regardless of technological ability.
Connection options:

WIRELESS DEVICE & WIRELESS INTERNET*: Connect smart 
phones, tablets, laptops, or desktops wirelessly to Gordian, and then 
join an available secured or open wireless network in the vicinity.
WIRED DEVICE & WIRELESS INTERNET**: Connect desktops, 
laptops, tablets via wire to Gordian, and then join either an open or 
secured wireless network in the vicinity.WIRELESS DEVICE & WIRED INTERNET*: Connect your home 
router or internet connection via wire to Gordian and then wirelessly 
connect any mobile device or laptop to Gordian on your own secure 
network.WIRED DEVICE & WIRED INTERNET*: Connect your home 
router or internet connection via wire to Gordian and then wirelessly 
connect any mobile device or laptop to Guardian on your own secure 
network.* This was recently implemented, and we will be performing more testing in the coming months (with your help, of course!)
** This is already an implemented and well-tested feature of Gordian.                            

Technical details:
Our
 firmware unlocks a massively important feature set, and we are working 
with partners to pair it with the best hardware components in the long 
term. In the future, we’d like to build custom hardware… but we’re in 
the firmware business, and the best way for us to get that to the world 
is to ship it on preexisting hardware which we have thoroughly tested 
and that we trust. This gives users (from the least tech-savvy to 
seasoned hackers) automatic use of the Tor anonymity network on a very 
secure device. Our firmware utilizes some great tried and true open 
source software components, including OpenWRT, Tor, etc.. We built the 
entire user interface from the ground up to provide a simplified 
workflow designed to be used by people of most any technological ability (currently available in English exclusively).
Our prototypes are already leaps and bounds ahead of competition in functionality and efficiency. Our team is working diligently to perfect and test the newest and most revolutionary feature of Gordian: FULL WIRELESS OPERATION! 


Oh no, another Tor-enabled router! (Our History)
We started our project years ago (circa 2011)
 and slowly and steadily made progress toward a foolproof usable privacy
 solution. Initial prototypes were large, clunky, ugly, and consumed 
power like a hungry baboon loves chocolate cake. What we needed were 
smaller, cheaper, more capable, and more power efficient hardware so we 
could continue with what we do best---hacking, packaging, and improving 
user experience. What we needed was what the future 
provided---inexpensive travel routers, SoCs, and infinite possibilities!
 That future is now.
In addition to our years of testing out new 
and newer devices as potential hardware vehicles for a practical, 
usable, portable, plug-and-play Tor-enabled gateway, we also watched as 
many Tor-enabled router projects came and went, most for wired-only 
connectivity, and all with the same critical flaws---their inability to 
handle the three really important scenarios:


Acting as a wireless client to connect to wireless networks for Internet access (needed in many cafes, restaurants, hotels, and airports)
Support for captive portals and hotspots

Support mobile phones, tablets, and devices without Ethernet ports by simultaneously acting as a secured wireless access point and a wireless client


What sets our project apart from our older cousins? Gordian does all that right out of the box! And with a super-simple interface that 
doesn't require users to write a single line of code.
Oh, yeah, and.. we've just spent the last 11 months testing it out everywhere from fast food restaurants to coffeehouses to college campuses. 
We'll never look at french fries the same ever again...


What do we know, anyway? (About Us)
We
 are a team from a variety of research, development, and business 
backgrounds, living and loving life in a highly-innovative college town 
near four universities.
Our team consists of 11 individuals (and 
rapidly growing!) who not only believe in this product, but who also 
have years of experience:

researching the usable security and privacy problems
researching and modeling networks and network security


writing software and firmware that run on devices (embedded Linux and microcontrollers alike)
running successful businesses and NGOs

managing financial assets exceeding $1.5 million USD
developing marketing strategies for Fortune 500 firms
producing award-winning photography and videography projects
customer service management and order fulfillment



How will backers' money be used? (Our Goals)
After we
 allocate finances to fulfill the rewards we've listed for various 
support amounts (it's our first obligation!) a good portion of the funds
 you donate will go toward hardware/merchandise and shipping costs. 
Then, tentatively but subject to change, remaining funds will be applied
 to the development costs associated with the following goals. So before
 moving forward with design and innovation, we will fulfill the rewards 
we've listed for each level of giving. 
It is important to note 
that each Gordian device we deliver through this Indiegogo campaign 
will be a fully functional beta-device. We will have put the hardware 
and firmware through rigorous testing. Building on the foundation laid 
by our Indiegogo supporters, we will continue to innovate our firmware 
and work toward developing a custom enclosure with additional 
functionality (think a slimmer profile). We're in this for the long 
haul, and we firmly believe Gordian should be thoughtfully designed as 
well as practically useful.
BRIEFLY: We did the math, and every
 1000 devices we produce could require upwards of 250 person-hours 
(man-hours) for assembly/QA/handling, plus shipping costs.  It's also 
quite difficult to staff full-time employees on a temporary basis. These
 factors could contribute the greatest to costs associated with 
fulfilling our rewards, and we've set our various reward price points to
 maximize our ability to follow through.


Goals:

Strengthen core feature set mentioned above
Improve user experience even more (we have a lot of ideas to implement in the interface.)
Further testing in many different environments (even internationally)
Foster a community of users to support one another; Anything related to Tor involves community, and we love that.
Develop ability to auto-update firmware (in a secure manner)
Communicate with the utmost transparency and honesty
Build a comprehensive brand and a strong web-presence (website)
Develop marketing strategies (positioning and market research)
Setup shipping structure for worldwide delivery
Create a marketplace for promoting innovative usable security and 
privacy services to help people locate them and become educated about 
their usefulness

If our funding goal is exceeded, we will look into applying a 
portion of the funds toward developing (which could include hiring) 
several of our long-term stretch goals, including but not limited to the
 following list. Of course, stretch goals are not guaranteed within this
 campaign, but are intended to give potential backers a brain-dump---a 
glimpse of our broader vision and desires related to our project's 
focus, things that we think would be cool to see.
Stretch Goals:

Building much-needed secure/private/anonymous services that are easy to use (and inherently safe to access through our firmware)
Promoting secure-by-design and private-by-design software through 
improving usability, user experience, support, and education---getting 
today's best protection into the hands of everyone
Researching and developing secure/private/anonymous Cloud services, 
as well as completely decentralized peer-to-peer products that 
auto-scale, can never be monitored, and can never be shut down
Developing firmware/feature enhancements based upon user feedback
Possibly building meaningful partnerships with like-minded projects and developers
Possibly exploring additional future hardware options, depending upon funds, potential ROI, and user feedback
Networking efforts with individuals, organizations, NGOs, 
non-profits, journalists, and even foreign governments who are concerned
 about their privacy to help us cater solutions to their needs
Support for RADIUS or WPA Enterprise 












The bottom line
Goal of this project: We'd
 love your support in enabling us to do what we do best: creatively pair
 components, refine user experience, and get a safer-to-use Tor solution
 into the hands of everyday human beings in the form of a super-portable
 router preconfigured to run Tor which can (with our innovative firmware
 solutions) support captive portals and hotspots. To the best of our 
knowledge, this is something that no one has ever accomplished before!
Vision of our company:
 We believe our approach is uniquely positioned to be a game changer in 
how everyone from road warrior designers to Fortune 500 executives 
enjoys affordable and reliable Internet security. If in the long run all
 we do is increase awareness of Tor and create momentum in usable 
security and privacy demand and development (even for projects or 
businesses other than our own) we'll be able to sleep at night; however,
 with your support, we might possibly be able to position our company as
 an industry influencer with many other usable security and privacy 
projects to come!




Risks & Challenges
We have been working with a hardware manufacturer for our 
developmental prototype Gordian already, and this manufacturer has promised to be able to provide enough units for us to fulfill our rewards to our Indiegogo supporters within a reasonable time frame. (We are interested in finding a backup manufacturer too, just in case.)
Because simultaneous wireless network and wireless device connections,
 as well as simultaneous wired network and wired device connections, are 
both new features we have just implemented, we will need to perform 
further testing prior to shipment and they are the most likely culprits for potential bugs. We have noticed in tests that, upon initially connecting to a wireless network when using the simultaneous wireless network and wireless device connectivity (fully-wireless operation), some personal devices seem to briefly disconnect and reconnect to the wireless access point provided by Gordian---this does not seem to prevent the Gordian from being usable, but we hope to find ways to improve this experience while performing further testing. Those who pledge support and receive one or more Gordian units should consider the devices they receive to be an initial public beta version of the Gordian router.  As with any beta device, there is the potential for limitations that will be improved upon in future versions of the device based upon user feedback.Wireless network connections 
(including WPA/WPA2 Personal, but not including RADIUS or WPA Enterprise
 yet) with wired personal device connections are well-tested and 
working quite well, in our opinion.Our Gordian router makes use of the third-party Tor anonymity network; as such, it is subject to the performance overhead and other constraints associated with the use of Tor.
FAQsWhy don’t you _____________?We’re hoping to have feedback from people like you who influence Gordian’s development, because we want Gordian to solve the real needs of people just like you.  If you don’t see a response to your question in the other FAQs (below) then please ask us! How do we know you’re not influenced by the government and have built a backdoor into your device?Unlike many indiegogo projects we are actually an incorporated entity, and we have built various canaries* into our platform which indicate we have not NOT been forced by any government agencies to compromise user: security, privacy, financials, locations.*in this application, a canary is a regularly-posted notification which states that we haven’t received any court orders. One of ours looks like this. What security expertise do you have that enabled you to develop this device?Our team is comprised of a number of people who bring different skills and experience to the table, but the primary development of our firmware was spearheaded by a published PhD student and former adjunct instructor whose research focused on usable security solutions.Why should people trust you?We intend our video explanations to provide some ethos and help build trust. And we desire to further simplify and improve Internet privacy; we have clearly stated our vision and we think it’s something many people will get behind.The digital age is full of huge potential for good but without intentional effort we may sacrifice more privacy than we’d like. Gordian has the potential to deliver the best of Tor (anonymity and security) with greater convenience than ever before.Why has it taken you four years to build "another" Tor router?Our project originally started as a solution to a specific need by a specific NGO performing work abroad, where they were concerned with privacy and security on public networks. Initial prototypes were much larger due to a different hardware platform that we used for development at the time. It wasn’t until recently that a public awareness and resulting need arose, which also led to us adopting a recently-available hardware platform that is much smaller than our original prototypes.Why have you chosen a flexible funding campaign (rather than fixed), and why Indiegogo?Originally we did approach Kickstarter; they were interested in us releasing Gordian as a software solution to run on a variety of platforms. But as Gordian is a combination of software components, much of which is very hardware specific (firmware and drivers), we decided rather than compromise the integrity of the project or haggle with Kickstarter, we would move our campaign to Indiegogo – which we’ve found to be a solid and successful platform. And we decided to go with flexible funding because we have big hopes for this project which go beyond shipping some devices, but we don’t need to reach a particular critical mass to begin shipping beta devices.Are you hosting your project on Github where people can parse the code etc? And will you be open sourcing the software and hardware in time? With Gordian not being a single piece of software (but a combination of multiple bits of firmware, drivers, settings, and even a web server) and also a minimum viable product, at this point we think going open source would be confusing. (A very dynamic amalgamation is difficult to just throw up on Github). Ultimately, we don’t have an issue opening our source and may well do so, but at this point we don’t see it as all that helpful. There are many Tor enabled routers, why should people want yours?That’s simple, Gordian is the only totally wireless client of its kind available in the world!While the basic concept has been around in security circles for a while, the simplicity of this solution is what’s next generation.For this reason, Gordian is truly unique, and we’re excited about it. But our vision goes beyond a device sitting next to someone’s computer, our vision concerns Internet privacy and security as a whole. We’re excited about Tor and bringing it to the next level—Gordian has the potential to bring many more users to the network which will actually improve the anonymity for other users. Furthermore, we dream of software solutions that exist within or are built upon the Tor network, such as truly secure peer to peer messaging and possibly even business solutions as well.Back to the top

story:
Our research found people love sending video messages however sending videos digitally is not very attractive and not a great gift solution.

VideoGram combines both aspects of card giving and gift giving into one as the card can remain as a keep sake for years to come.  

We have also built an online editing platform into our website which lets customers create their own unique videos within minutes which either us or you can upload to the card.

We aim to close the gap between the digital world and physical world by combining both worlds and providing a unique and stunning product that everyone will love. 


VideoGram invitations uses the same VideoGram technology to produce bespoke custom made wedding or event invitations.

Send invitations to your wedding, birthday parties, or any event using a videogram. We’ll create bespoke cards unique to you, custom artwork, and your video. Minimum order quantity for this product is 200 units. 

We also create custom cards as brochures for your business, custom artwork of your company, logos, product description. We will upload your company video to the cards which you can send to your clients for maximum impact. Minimum order quantity for this product is 200 units.

At VideGram we believe everyone has a story to tell and that a video is the best way to tell your story. Our online video editing software lets you create stunning videos within minutes, which can be uploaded to a VideoGram card or uploaded to Facebook or any other social network. 

My MovieMaker is a simple and a fun experience. Simply upload your photos and videos from your mobile, laptop and other devices, choose a theme and select a song. Our sophisticated technology uses artificial intelligence which combines your videos/photos adds a theme and adds music to create a movie unique and special to you. Its as simple as that!


Risks & Challenges

We have recently been picked up by Argos a very large UK retailer, and should be 'live' with them over the next few months.

In terms of fulfilling orders to Indiegogo members, there aren't many obstacles foreseen as we have manufacturing capabilities in place to produce thousands of units, and estimate delivery of all orders within 3 weeks of receiving funds.


Our VideoGram Christmas cards are also now available to order and will be delivered anywhere in the world by the first week of December. Simply select the VideoGram Christmas card option at the rewards section. 


Why we need funding. 
We have spent a lot of money on development and bringing this concept to market. We truly believe that this product deserves to be out there and be seen as its a great concept and we get a great response from anyone who sees it. We have been picked up by Argos a large uk chain retailer and need funding to support their orders. We would also like to expand into the US market and the rest of the world. 
Please help us get this product off the ground, your support means a lot to us. Thanking you in advance. Karan

story:
Brief summary

Our team  believes in, "to give something back, and to make a difference with its contributors".So we have decided to make not profit on telephone calls of people contributing to our project, and with the offer per-second billing, at our cost price:

You earn and save money on your calls.

&

We earn to move forward with our project.

Click to see the Price per minute for your favorite destinations,in case of contribution (Here is some examples )


Here is a short description, how you will be charged per second at our cost price, now and in the future (a detailed explanation on the number of months, the number of free minutes will be given more below)


Video explaining the 60$ contributions



What we need and what you get

    You Get

  • Be the first person to be billed per second and without connection fees for your local and international calls!

  • Be the first person to receive a discount of 50% on avarage on local and international calls over 60 months!

  • The table below provides a summary of what you earn by contributing to this project.


    Our Needs 

  • the funds raised will enable us to develop new partnerships with various stakeholders in telecommunications, so we can offer even lower prices than we offer you today.

  • Our goal is to improve the design and style of our existing communication system, the development of other services such as stickers and video, as well as other features, such as a function that gives you the ability to backup and restore your calls and messages (this feature will allow you to avoid losing your history when you change mobile phone).

  • Timeline


You can start to use and test our system on




If you have questions that you do not find an answer here, we are pleased to answer 

just use the comment tab or send us an e-mail to 


chabbouh.adel@bluewin.ch


Frequently Asked Questions

Why should I contribute to your project and use your system? I already have viber and skype.

  • you can keep them, all by adding our system, because our will also allow you to make calls and send free message, but if necessary to make local or international calls to someone that do not have viber, or skype or Bbee, contributing to our project you will receive communication cost 50% less expensive because you will be charged the cost of acquisition.

How you will identify me to ensure my discount ?

  • you will be identified by your cell phone number

Can I contribute to your project and give you my landline number?

  • Yes, in this case you will need a VoIP phone, you should book with us (of course with tarrif client privilege), but transportation costs are extra.

How do I do, if during the period of discount I change my number?

  • no worries, just give us your phone number and we transfer your data (duration of discounts & credit) to this new number.

When can I start taking advantage of this discount offer?

  • 2 months after the end of the companion, the time to contact our contributors by email, thanking them for their support & confirm with them their phone number

Other ways to help us

You can not contribute, it does not mean that you can not help us:

  •  spread the word and advertise around our project.
  • use Indiegogo sharing tools!

******************************************************************

story:
ABOUT

We are a Team of connector developers, who have be working in the Information Transport System (ITS) industry for more than 10 years.  Over the years that we worked on ITS cabling products, we find that new solutions could be proposed to simply the way cabling has been done.  

We live in a world of inter-connected networks.  Almost every home has some network cabling.  It is quite often that you would need new cabling or change existing cabling from time to time.  Usually you would need to call your cable installer to do the professional job.  You could also get yourself some training, and buy some tools to do the job by yourself.  We have a solution which would make this job easier.

Our new connector Direct Attach Bending RJ45 (DAB-RJ) can be installed easily WITHOUT professional training and specialized crimp tool, as would be needed with legacy RJ45 plugs.


EASY AND LOW FAILURE CONNECTION

The DAB-RJ is designed so that it can be easily installed correctly.  The DAB-RJ is designed with our patent pending Flexible PCB technology so that common problems of the network connector can be avoided.

Problem 1 - often occurs during the transportation and handling of the connector, could ultimately lead to improper crimping

Problem 2 - damaged crimp tool, could ultimately lead to improper crimping


Example of mis-contact due to improper crimping

Problem 3 - cable compatibility associated with plug types are sometime s confusing.  If a solid cable is connected to a plug designed for stranded cable, there will be connection problems.


THE DIRECT ATTACH

The concept of direct attached connection is also a new concept to simplify unnecessary connection points in the cabling system.


THE BENDING

The Bendable design of DAB-RJ allows bending of the connector body without compromising the transmission performance.  This allows the plug to be used in space limited environment, and also relief bending stress on the network cable.



FIELD OF APPLICATIONS

  • Network cabling - 10/100/1000/10 000 Base-T Ethernet
  • Premise Cabling - patch cord assembly, consolidation points
  • ISDN- VoIP
  • Token Ring 4/16 Mibts – 100 VG-AnyLAN
  • TP-PMD/TP-DDI – ATM 155, 622, 1200 Mbits
  • Ethersound
  • HDBase-T
  • Industrial Ethernet
  • Profinet
  • Field Cabling - Non-user-administered IP facility devices such as security cameras, lighting controls, industrial sensors, and Wi-Fi access points.
  • Electronic Safety and Security (ESS) System Design, which the end devices links are relatively permanent


CABLING SPECIFICATIONS

  • ISO 11801 Edition 2 – Class E, EN 50173 Edition 2 – Class D, Class E, Class Ea
  • EIA/ TIA 568-C.2 - Channel performance for Cat 3, Cat 5e, Cat 6, Cat 6A
  • TIA1096-A (formerly FCC part 68)
  • BICSI/ANSI D005– “Electronic Safety and Security (ESS) Information Transport System (ITS) Design and Implementation Best Practices”
  • ANSI/TIA-862-A Building automation system


KEY FEATURES

  • Frequency Bandwidth 0~500MHz
  • Installation of solid twisted cable for long distance transmission
  • Adaptable to big and small OD conductors (22~24awg, solid)
  • Cable OD 5~8.5mm
  • Easy for field installation, no special crimping or impact tool required for termination.
  • Plug dimension compliant with FCC part 68 standard
  • Color codes
  • TIA 568 A/B
  • Industrial 4 pins
  • Balun connection
  • Audio/video connections


CABLING PERFORMANCE



TECHNOLOGY

Our Team have spent a lot of effort in Research and Development to bring you this innovative solution.  This connector is highly engineered.  We have used computer simulations to optimize our design.  All the technical characteristics of this 

product have been verified in a professional laboratory.


DEVELOPMENT SCHEDULE

What you seen on the photos and video above are working prototypes.  These prototypes are fully functional tested.  We’ve already initiated the tooling and we expect to ship on January 13, 2014.  Depending where you are in the world, your DAB-RJ will arrive at your place in 2~3 weeks.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help through pre-orders to help funding commercialization of the DAB-RJ.  With your help, we can accelerate in our mold development, and launch our production orders.  This is also one of our assessment of demand for our product.  We would love to hear from you, our supports, at the early stage of our product commercialization.  Your comments are very important for us.  Further down the road, we hope to build long term relationship with our early supporters to continuously improve our product.


Complimentary Goodie - simple cable stripper and wire cutter in one!

Your installation can be done with this simple complimentary tool, and no other tool required.


Please support us by pre-ordering.

Or tell your friends and family about us :)

Thank you very much for your support!
